Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: glenhodgso
Reviews.Content: Stayed on Executive floors - great breakfast. Dined in Regatta restaurant first night - excellent service with great humour. All the staff we met from check-in to check-out were helpful and without exception seemed happy in their work - and to me that matters way more than anything else. If I was being picky I could say that the decor was a little tired, but you overlook these things when the service is first class. Situated in the middle of downtown, this hotel is right at the heart of all attractions and stores. We used the hotel as our base for our first couple of days in Seattle and look forward to returning next week on our way home.

Reviews.Title: “Great People work here.”
Reviews.Author: drose12
Reviews.Content: I love it when people act like they enjoy their job and this is the case at the Crowne Plaza. Had a nice corner room. Asked for quiet.Location is perfect. Had calm chower in the bar. Very good service.

Reviews.Title: “As expected no good/bad surprises”
Reviews.Author: Paulo82UK
Reviews.Content: Relative to other Crowne Plazas worldwide, this is very similar. Staying 4 days on the 33rd exec floor it was a nice view for sure, and the location is excellent for walking to major tourist attractions. Room service is expensive as expected, but the food is of a higher than usual standard. I did not have a vehicle so cannot comment on parking. Room for improvement: Definitely something up with the HVAC system. A 2 degree change would cause it to alternate between AC/Heating which led to some loud night time ventilation. I ended up switching it off so I could sleep. The lifts seem to be programmed obscurely and there can be long waits for lifts at peak times.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate experience”
Reviews.Author: Betty C
Reviews.Content: A group of women friends met in Seattle for a mid-week shopping experience. We stayed 2 nights at the Crowne Plaza downtown. All of us remarked that we had never stayed anywhere with a friendlier, happy staff than this hotel. Each person who had any dealing with our experience there was genuinely charming...not in a fake or contrived or ingenuous way, but in such a way that made us feel part of a bigger, happier world. Truly remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Parking is expensive”
Reviews.Author: VIAboytes
Reviews.Content: Everything was good except the parking was not cheap!

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN GOOD VALUE DOWNTOWN HOTEL...”
Reviews.Author: SunSandH20
Reviews.Content: The Crown Plaza in downtown Seattle is a good location, solid, basic, clean hotel. The exterior and lobby area are very dated but the guest rooms have been tastefully remodeled. All of the staff members were professional for this kind of limited not frills hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Regatta restaurant exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Trip W
Reviews.Content: Quality stay at this great location in March 2012! Easy walking distance to Pikes Place Market, 5th avenue shops and restaurants, and waterfront. We are Priority Club Plantinum level members so our upgrades to 32 and 33rd floors (2 separate stays) gave us fantastic views of the city. On our second stay, we decided to stay and eat at the hotel's restautant, the Regatta. My wife had the Mahi Mahi and I had the pork tenderloin. We did not have very high expectations because it's the hotel's restaurant. To our pleasant surprise, the food was outstanding! The Mahi Mahi was much better than the same fish we had at a very nice restaurant on the waterfront. I don't usually write tripadvisor reports, but I really wanted to do so and complement the hotel and restaurant team! Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, close to everything, but no free wireless”
Reviews.Author: endsun
Reviews.Content: Nice location and my room on the 23rd floor was good for two people. We were across from the elevator, but weren't disturbed by hallway noise. Staff was friendly and helpful. Had some well mixed drinks at the lounge. Chairs were really comfy and provided a good venue to kick back and relax. My only beef is no free wireless. This should be a standard at business hotels - particularly in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Vixen719
Reviews.Content: I actually liked this hotel, mainly because of the location. I was in seattle for a week and I was able to go to a different restaruant every night that was within walking distance to the hotel. The staff was very helpful in recommending restaurants althought they weren't good about telling you how much the food is at the restaurant they were recommending. Of course it's seattle so there is a starbucks on every corner. The one nearest to the hotel was maybe two blocks down, and there was also a subway right next door for something quick and easy. The only thing that was strange about this hotel was the fact that they didn't have a microwave in the room. I thought that was the standard for most hotels but I guess I was wrong. The hotel room was very clean and the view from the window was nice although I didn't get a view of the water. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: skottilil
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. I have stayed here a few times. Nice spacious rooms, high rise and nicely located. The staff is really helpful and the hotel is easily accessible by train as well as car. The food is good. Fitness center is available all the time and is decent. The elevators can slow you down at peak times otherwise this is a great hotel to stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay......”
Reviews.Author: Hannah M
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review as I feel compelled to let everyone know that this hotel is exceptional for the price. I booked through a 3rd party, one of those deals that you don’t know where you are staying until you have paid. The Crowne Plaza Seattle was a delight to deal with. Once I had booked online I called and spoke to a gentleman call Dontay, he was polite, helpful and attentive. He answering all my questions and reassured me that my reservation had been received. Upon check in we were greeted by Paul, he was very friendly, helpful and was kind enough to give us an upgrade to a bigger room with a view of the Space needle. After the exceptional service that we received At the Crowne Plaza Seattle I would highly recommend this hotel for any one either on business or away on a weekend with friends. Overall: Clean, comfortable, happy staff from the desk to the housekeepers. My only down point is that there was no hot tub…… I will definitely stay again :)

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RyanJ11804
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the crowne plaza, we had a room with a great view of the space needle and enjoyed a walk to some many of the local attractions in the area. Service was everything we expected. Would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but...”
Reviews.Author: Lighty1966
Reviews.Content: Good clean comfortable hotel. Staff are helpful and friendly. We booked via Hotwire and were rather shocked to see parking at $40 per night (once taxes included) and wi-fi at $10 per day. Lesson learned on Hotwire there. Only complaint with the hotel was the noisy rooms. We thought the air conditioning was stuck on, so had the engineer up to our room to check (the guy came quickly, even though it was midnight). We were told that the noise was coming from the wind gushing past the vent, it wasn't air conditioning at all, and the noise couldn't be stopped. Every room is like that! Thankfully we had ear plugs, there was no way we were going to sleep with that noise. Have never been in a hotel like that. Sadly would not go back to this hotel for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: vmichel54
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice during the month of January and enjoyed both stays. They have a wonderful complimentary wine tasting in the early evening and they were very accommodating with any of our needs. The location is outstanding and parking, although not free, was very quick and easy. They allowed us to leave our car long after our check out time so we stayed in town and shopped after our stay. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Ken E
Reviews.Content: I have have stayed a couple times at the Crowne Plaza Seattle and have been pleased both times. The staff has always been friendly and willing to accommodate my special requests. All three rooms I've stayed in have been clean, large, and have had great views of the city. I have been pleased by the club-level snack provided in mornings and evenings with a wide selection and fresh fruit and vegetables, along with a selection of hot food in the evening. The hotel is conveniently located near hundreds of restaurants and is within walking distance of many tourist attractions and shopping. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel-Not the best in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: LionTraveller1995
Reviews.Content: I visited the wonderful city of Seattle in early July 2011 and was very pleased with the city. While I was there i stayed with my parents in the Crowne Plaza. Upon first seeing the hotel i was worried about the location being very close to the Interstate and how nosiy it was going to be in are room. But luckly the windows in the hotel are very sound proof. The outside of the hotel, 70's concerte walls and brown glass which is a very un-comfortable look and made the hotel look very dull. The atrium in the lobby is very nice and the check-in staff are very helpful. The slowest Elevators I have EVER used in my life! The rooms where of a big size, the colour choise was not the best, being very dark and boring. The bathroom was very dated. The daily USA Today was very nice. The beds were a bit small. The breakfast was amazing! All the food was lovely, all fresh and plenty of choice. But overall an avarage hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza standard+”
Reviews.Author: Oliver K
Reviews.Content: fairly ok, staff helpful. Breakfast staff quite committed to deliver good experience. Location great, good jogging path. Parking very expensive (but probably not a Crowne-Plaza specific problem in downtown Sea)

Reviews.Title: “I did like all about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LESMEX
Reviews.Content: Great location, big rooms, nice staff, The bathroom is very nice, the beds are a little small but in general it's a nice hotel, ask for a Hight floor facing the entrance I mean the side of the entrance of the hotel because the other side is a Hight way but still both sides are very quiet

Reviews.Title: “Totally Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Ruby W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel! I loved seattle and this hotel made our trip even better! We especially loved the lounge area! During our down time of our trip we would go down there for a drink or two! The manager there especially made us feel so welcomed and made us feel special! He was so sweet and catered to our needs! He was also helpful giving us ideas of things to do in this lovely city!! They had excellent food too! We stayed in one night and had dinner down there!! When I go back I am gonna stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Noora H
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel! No complaints at all. We only spend one night before catching a flight the next day, but if we come back to Seattle we´ll be sure to return. Location was good, ok walk to the harbour etc. Check-in was quick and the hotel was really clean and the room was big. We had a great city view from the 17th floor. We got a good price and it also included breakfast. And what a great breakfast that was! They didn´t have a buffet that day, so we were told that we can order anything we want from the breakfast menu. We had THE BEST waiter, Richard, who had a great sense of humour and really made our day! Breakfast was one of the most delicious I´ve had. Overall I can totally recommend this hotel for cleanliness, location and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Too lazy to change, fells like home”
Reviews.Author: Clovicek
Reviews.Content: My favorite hotel in Seattle, I have been staying for 10 years. It is because I dont like change and also because it feels like home. I get nice upgrade everytime, the upper floors have great view of the city and priority club louge is great as well. Nice location, close to the piers and downtown as we as easy entry/exit to I5. The hotel feels dated and little run down, rooms are older design, but nice, large and clean. The elevators are slow which is a major issue on busy mornings. Breakfast room has no personality. I am still a fan:)

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinemkp
Reviews.Content: Older property that feels run down and dated. The eleavators are so slow! The staff is hit and miss on service. The only thing I liked was the location which is that the hotel is located on the outskirts of downtown and only a few minutes walk from most things.

Reviews.Title: “Crown Plaza is perfect hotel/perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: Steve J
Reviews.Content: Our stay during the holidays at the Crowne Plaza was wonderful. The staff was so nice, very friendly. We parked at the hotel and walked everywhere we wanted to see. The Christmas tree and lights were just beautiful, they even served Christmas cookies and hot apple cider in the lobby. The rooms are large and very comfortable. We got adjoining rooms with our family, and that was perfect. It was recommended to me, and we pass this on to you! Enjoy Seattle....stay at the Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: GrammaRia
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, right downtown Seattle. Our room was nice and roomy with a nice view - granted it was of the freeway, but still was nice at night to sit and watch the traffic - no noise at all. The staff was very friendly - with the exception of the lounge/restaurant. The elevator dumps you mid-restaurant and it was confusing on where to go. There was no staff around at first and then the one guy we saw just ignored us. We found the bar but the bartender was busy and also ignored us. A waitress finally showed up after we had been sitting a while (we almost walked out but there was no where else to get food) and we ordered a snack and drink. The drink was not what I expected, but not the fault of the staff. They did let us carry our drinks back to our room. The room was nice and had some pluses: flat-screen TV; blow-dryer; large closet; as I said, a nice view of the freeway and some of the skyscrapers; a wall-attached magnifying makeup mirror (a plus in my book) and nightlights, so we didn't have to leave the bathroom light on to see around once the curtains were closed. The main negative for us was it was strictly valet parking and it cost $32 to park - even tho we were paying quite a lot for the room. The valet was quick in the morning to get the car so we weren't late for our clipper ride. All in all, it wasn't a bad stay. I only gave 4 stars due to the charge for parking and the staff in the lounge. I would recommend it if you can overlook those 2 items.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 3.5 Star; could be much more with some additional investment”
Reviews.Author: bowman716
Reviews.Content: As a travel professional I'm in Seattle regularly as well as spending around 100 nights per year in hotels. The Good Stuff: Hotwire deals for well under $100. Front desk personnel were friendly and professional; very knowledgeable about the property and city. Food was reasonably priced (for a hotel) and tasty. My king room was large and partially renovated; with fridge, robes and was clean/smelled nice. Bed, linens and pillows were excellent. Areas that fell short: Bathroom is old (just like the building); partially renovated but not to today's standards. Desk and floor lamp were ugly and beaten up; like something from an old Holiday Inn. Public areas; especially the lobby are not inviting, old and dingy. Vales/Doorman never offered to help me with my 3 bags or even open a door?

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel handy location large rooms”
Reviews.Author: kiwisolargal
Reviews.Content: Easy to find and handy to downtown, Pike Place, Hard Rock Cafe etc. Found it easy to walk around and parked our car in the nearby public carpark and saved on the hotel parking fee which was quite expensive. This hotel had interconnecting rooms and we were on the 22nd floor we overlooked the motorway which was a little noisy but for us Kiwi's we quite enjoyed watching the traffic below us. Good views out towards the mountains also. The beds were very comfy and the hotel bathrooms were well equipped, clean and spacious. Staff we dealt with were friendly and accommodating. Would stay here again. Free wifi another bonus for the teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “It'll do the job”
Reviews.Author: AirFairy
Reviews.Content: I stay here numerous times a year and for the location, it's awesome! You are within walking distance of some of Seattle's greatest offerings. From Pike Place Market, the pier, Westlake mall, it's wonderfully located. What I don't like is how evidently old the building must be. The heating cooling system is ancient, and some rooms have the analog control on the wall which is fine (though I prefer the digital controls like a lot of hotels have) but some rooms have a wall heater that you raise the cover too and it always looks broken, like it either won't close all the way or open all of the way. Some knobs may be missing, hard to turn, etc. My other gripe is the towels. Can they not afford Downy?! Or any fabric softener?! Those things will rub your skin off. Food in the bar is pricey late at night. A basket of french fries was $6.95?! $12 burgers don't come with a side? If this was Boston or NY I could understand, but when there are good eats just footsteps from your property, you would expect better pricing. The beds are comfy though and they use white duvet covers and that's HUGE for me. I need to know that my linens from top to bottom have been washed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: msphx12
Reviews.Content: Standard hotel room. Great mattress on the bed! Staff friendly. Good downtown location. Cabs always available. Concierge stored my luggage for 8 hours after checking out. Restaurant in hotel. Breakfast bar fully stocked. All fresh. Servers extremely accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: Rogers488
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 29th floor and loved the view. You could see the Space Needle, the Pike Place Market sign and the sound. Our suite had plenty of room and the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Tasha M
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay here.. Staff were friendly and always ready to help. Nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service! Beautiful Property!”
Reviews.Author: lovesthenorthwest
Reviews.Content: I would like to start off by recognizing Dante at the front desk. We booked our room last minute through Hotwire. From my experience, hotels treat Hotwire guests like bottom feeders since the rate is so low. In this case, Dante treated us like we were VIPs. From the moment he greeted us, he was very accommodating, courteous, and professional. He gave us a complimentary upgrade to one of the Parlor Suites on the 30th floor. The room was gorgeous, well appointed, and very clean and spacious. The bed was to die for! The restaurant was very comfortable, very lounge like and a great place to grab a bite and drink after a long day. Our server was great, and very personable. We took advantage of the breakfast buffet the restaurant offered the next morning. The arrangement of food was of good quality and very good! I would recommend Crown Plaza to anyone who cares about getting 5 star treatment at a more affordable price. It is clear that this property values its guests and loves to make a memorable impression.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the middle of things to do”
Reviews.Author: Udoggie
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Seattle Crowne Plaza a couple of times in the past year or so. Very friendly staff, clean rooms, and loads of stuff to do near the hotel. The convention center is a few blocks away, as are a lot of dining options. The Pike Street Market is within easy walking distance too. 4pm checkin time (however I've been able to get an early checkin by just asking), and a noon checkout time is pretty typical. I've never actually ate at the hotel restaurant, as there's so many options nearby. I'd stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service and great location...”
Reviews.Author: Fjeldbar
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times. Employees are very helpful and friendly. Location us great and close to light rail train ti airport if you can walk a few blocks. Ask for a corner room on north side for views and less noise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Parakeet701
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here in September 2011 and had a lovely stay. Our room was very spacious with a beautiful view of the Space Needle. The bed was very comfortable, one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in. The room was clean and we had everything we needed. Only complaint about the room was that it was a handicapped bathroom so there was just an open shower with no sides, therefore we flooded the bathroom each time we took a shower. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We didn't try the food in the hotel restaurant as it was a bit pricey for us. The location was excellent. A short walk of 2 blocks to the light rail station which took us to the airport. And only a 10 minute walk to the market and the bay. Pretty much a 10 minute walk to all the attractions in downtown. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and service”
Reviews.Author: apickytraveller
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Crowne Plaza. Got a really good corporate rate and the room included free wifi and breakfast. As I understand it, compared to the Sheraton and Westin, the Crowne Plaza's rates are far more competitive. A taxi to/from the airport will cost you $39. If you feel like spoiling yourself or are in a group of more than 3, you can opt for a stretch limo for $45. The biggest plus is the location. Minutes walking distance from everything - Pacific Place, Pike Market, Nordstrom, Macy's, Louis Vitton, Gucci, Loft, Art galleries and restaurants. Simply walk to your left when exiting the hotel down Seneca and turn right on 5th Avenue. The Sheraton and Westin are slightly closer but you are only shaving off a couple of minutes. The front desk will supply a walking map. The front desk and concierge was very helpful with directions and suggestions on where to go, shop, etc. The hotel from the lobby, elevators, hallways and rooms are spotlessly clean. Housekeeping is very quiet and courteous. I had left a few personal care items at home and the front desk sent to my room right away. I had a Deluxe King Room on a high floor. Very spacious and great view. The bed was comfy, linens were crisp and bathroom was spotless. I'm not a huge fan of the Crowne Plaza chain's Renu soaps and toiletries, but that's just me. Much better than what Sheraton hotels offer in general, but nothing exceptional. I usually take my own anyway. The breakfast buffet was simple: omelette and waffle station, cereals, baked goods, fruit, meat and potatoes, pancakes, French toast. I was very satisfied with my omelette. If you are looking for a gourmet breakfast, then this is not the place for you. However, is you are looking for something simple with a few options, this is fine. I will stay here again. In terms of rating, I would give this a very high 3.5 - or 4 star, only losing points for not having a spa and gourmet dining. If you dont need a spa or gourmet food, the Crowne Plaza is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Not pleased at all”
Reviews.Author: melonfawn
Reviews.Content: The good: The room is very clean and the staff who checked us in were very nice. The bad: I had an allergic reaction to something in the room (my guess is the detergent used to wash the sheets) as after I had a nap I was covered in hives and all red all over. When checking out and asked if everything was to our satisfaction, I mentioned my issue and how it had caused me to have hardly any sleep, and rather than try to solve the problem the desk clerk just told me he would pass the message on to housekeeping. To be honest, when I go to a hotel I am paying for a night's rest as well as the other amenities, and if I don't get one and it's because of the hotel I feel I should have been offered some sort of compensation or price break. Very disappointed with the way I was treated, but life's too short to get your knickers in a bunch, so we just chalked it up to experience and will be sure to stay elsewhere in the future. Also, and this is minor compared to my other annoyance, but parking was a whopping $39 per night, and nowhere was it posted that it was that much. Internet is $10 a night. It all adds up!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: hsqueen
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful Hotel ,The rooms were nice and clean. The lady at the front desk was nice and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Visit To Seattle”
Reviews.Author: sandopdx
Reviews.Content: I took a quick trip to Seattle to visit a college friend. I booked a room at the Crowne Plaza in downtown Seattle. Although I was not impressed by the tiny lobby, I was happy with my 24th floor room which was spacious, well-appointed, and which had a great view. The hotel was walking distance to several Seattle tourist attractions, and I had a very pleasant walk prior to meeting my friend for dinner and a "night on the town." My friend joined me for a very pleasant breakfast (reasonably priced too) at the hotel served by friendly people. My former classmate dropped me off at the Amtrak station and I was soon on my way home. My visit was all too brief - I hope to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Blah”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca_ABQ
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and had nice linens. Safe located in closet. Everything worked. Restaurant located in building - cheap diner style. Bar located in building - average. Internet was chronic drama during our stay. Front desk staff had different answers every time we called. In the end, the front desk clerk cleared all of the error charges and charged us for one week of internet access. But for the cost of this hotel, internet service should be hassle free and free of charge. I forgot to bring a razor and the hotel provided a courtesy razor immediately on request - I was very grateful! Hotel located 5 blocks uphill from the main down town area. They are the steepest 5 blocks in the area! The city bus does not travel up this road. Tip - walk up Pine St. to 6th St. and then walk down to Seneca St.. Stayed at Crowne Plaza for work but arrived a few days early for vacation and stayed at Best Western Loyal Inn. Preferred Best Western in all ways and it included free hot breakfast, free delicious coffee, free internet, much closer to space needle, easy bus ride to Pike's Place and downtown and was cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Unremarkable in every respect”
Reviews.Author: Lael_Lael
Reviews.Content: This place is beyond boring as far a accommodations go. They do offer an extensive package of in room amenities on the house; including a sewing kit and rain bonnet. The beds are comfortable enough and there are lots of staff on hand to answer questions and such. The elevators are slow and the weight room mediocre. Assuming other options are available I will not ever stay there again. They did allow me to put down a $100 cash deposit when I forgot my credit card and there was no problem getting it back when I checked out in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: alexzhdanov
Reviews.Content: Very average property. Nothing special. Great location. Dated, so dated. The Club floor - only the name. So on)

Reviews.Title: “Very decent”
Reviews.Author: 20FlOz
Reviews.Content: Having read numerous reviews here, I was prepared well, so thanks TripAdvisor members! Upon check-in, asked for room away from highway, upper floor, and upgrade to Priority Club. There was no King bed available on the side away from highway but we were on the 30th floor facing southish, so I-5 is visible but noise isn't an issue. In fact it's neat to watch the highway traffic! Valet parking pretty stout, nearly $40/night. Room is comfortable, staff reaaaaaaaaaaaaaally nice (Deante? is from Georgia, for all you Southerners traveling here, and will TAKE CARE of you!! JessieRose at front desk was so friendly!). Very friendly and helpful staff all around, truly. So far this hotel deserves the good reviews I've seen, but being prepared made a big difference, I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Wendy48254
Reviews.Content: We were on the 29th floor with a great view of the skyline.The beds were extremely comfortable and there were plenty of pillows. The room was nice and quiet. The front desk staff were very helpful with bus routes and other directions.It was very clean. I think free WiFi is a must, and this hotel charges for WiFi. Also, although there was a coffee pot in the room it would be really nice to be able to get a quick cup of (free) coffee to take to the room in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Very busy and small lobby.”
Reviews.Author: keladykman
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, you can walk to all the attractions of the Downtown area. Close to the airport so taxi was very affordable. The room was comfortable and clean, but we requested a king and we got 2 doubles. We had dinner two nights in the restaurant and was very good and the service great, John, the waiter was extremely helpful and charming. Breakfast was very nice, buffet style whit a good selection of fruits, breads, pastries, and an egg station, or a la carte. The only downside was the hotel was very busy and the lobby was always pack and the elevators were terrible slow!

Reviews.Title: “Short walk to market and shopping.”
Reviews.Author: Stacy021020
Reviews.Content: Great room and view. We had early flight into Seattle. Hotel had room ready and welcoming. There are many great hotels in area, Hilton, Red Lion. I would not hesitate to stay at any of them. Crowne Plaza was great for us, though we spent most of our time at market or shopping. Recommend using light rail from airport to University St station. Inexpensive though takes longer than we had anticipated. The people in Seattle were extremely helpful. One flight attendant walked us to light rail platform - it would have been difficult to find without the help. Great places to eat -Pikes Brew Pub, the cheese making place on corner by market. So many good bakeries, coffee shops, chocolate, wine.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel to explore downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Mike W
Reviews.Content: I had been to Seattle many times in the past and always stayed down near BFI or SEA. Occasionally if time allowed I would take the subway into downtown to visit Pike's market etc. I've always told myself that I would stay downtown someday -- unfortunately downtown hotels have always been outside of my company's hotel budget guidance. On this trip, however, I started watching the rates at the Crown Plaza about a week prior to the trip. It was just $9 over our budget and I had high hopes that the rate would drop. Sure enough, a few days prior to the trip the rate fell within guidance and I quickly booked it. I chose not to rent a car this trip due to the hotel's $35/night parking fee. We took a cab to the hotel which was $20 from BFI and took about 15 minutes. Upon check-in the front desk staff quickly recognized our Priority Club Platinum status and upgraded us to mini-suites and provided access to the club level lounge. They also gave us coupons for free internet (lightning fast!), discounted breakfast buffet at the hotel restaurant, and a free drink. The room was a two-room suite right next to the elevators, but I never heard any elevator noise <phew!>. The "living room" included a comfortable couch and chair along with an LCD television and a refrigerator stocked with two bottles of water. The desk was adequate and included 3 electrical outlets and a desk-light. The only complain I have about the workspace is the desk-chair. I am 5'10" and even with the desk chair extended to as high as it would go, the top of the desk came up to my chest. This made it difficult to get some work done. I think the Crowne Plaza would be well served replacing these chairs by something a little more work-friendly. (or I suppose I could have sat on a phone book...) The bedroom includes a very nice, very comfortable king-sized bed. There is another LCD television on the wall, and a deep closet. I questioned how well the room had been cleaned because there was trash and an empty glass underneath the bed (yuck). The bathroom is small, but clean and adequate. Both rooms feature HUGE plate-glass windows that span the entire wall and overlook the city. Just beautiful! The club lounge on the 32nd floor is small but very well appointed. The staff is professional, friendly, and unobtrusive. I haven't had a chance to visit it for breakfast but the evening cocktail hours were nice. They had fresh baked pizza, fruit, vegetables, and warm cookies. Soda and water were free, however beer and wine were available for purchase. (in fairness they did have a nice selection). Tully's coffee was also available in the entryway. The hotel is located between 5th and 6th street. The walk to Pike's market is easy and takes only about 10 minutes. I would love to come back to this hotel with my family because Seattle is such a cool city and, quite honestly, I think that this hotel is better suited for family/tourism than it is for working. At this price point I would not hesitate to come back here again and I intend to write a similar review for our company's internal hotel recommendation message board so that other employees who are looking for hotels in Seattle may take advantage of this great property and convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “This met my needs perfectly”
Reviews.Author: homeinseak
Reviews.Content: The location was right downtown and close to everything. Front desk staff were very nice and helpful. The room was clean and in good shape. A couple of stains on the carpet but overall good shape. I wish hotels would stop charging steep prices for internet. It's an additional 9.95 here. I got a good deal via Orbitz so the price was comparable to others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location. Expensive.”
Reviews.Author: egatrop
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the C-P while attending a conference in downtown Seattle. The location is great for exploring downtown Seattle. Walking distances are shorter than maps portrait. The staff was very nice. The room was well maintainted. The view was great (32nd floor.) No surprise though- the Crown Plaza is expensive. If you want more of a Seattle feel, this may not be your best bet- As with most high end hotels, once you walk through the front door you could be anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel within walking distance of Pikes Place”
Reviews.Author: sjoconn
Reviews.Content: The rooms are pretty average rooms for a hotel of this quality. Where this hotel excells is convenience and service. From checking in until checkout I had a great experience with the staff here. There is a nice lounge and restaurant on the 2nd floor. Pikes place market is less than a 10 minute walk away and there are numerous restaraunts in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown option”
Reviews.Author: wiffee
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here for 5 nights. The hotel is centrally located, in the downtown retail area, 3 blocks to light rail line and tons of busses, many of which are free, 5 blocks to the Monorail, 7 or 8 blocks to Pike Place or Pioneer Sqare; all very walkable. The hotel is nicely appointed, classy lobby, lounge, ok restaurant. We got our rooms through Priceline, but being kind and curteous at check-in yielded us a room on the 24th floor, although still on the highway side of property. However, on a clear day you could see Mt. Rainier. (We used the fan on the AC to create white noise and had no problems sleeping.) The room was large (esp. for a big city hotel) with 2 queen beds, a desk, lounging chair and ottoman, flat-screen TV and fridge in the TV stand, and closet. The bath had a nice large counter. Our third night there was a major water leak on the floor above ours. We we away when it happened, but the staff moved our luggage and misc. so that nothing was damaged (offered to pay for any that was), gave us a free dinner, and upgraded us to a multi-room suite on the top floor! Wonderful views of the city, sound, and Space Needle. We were happy with our first room, but the second was a real treat. All the staff we dealt with were courteous and accomodating. Lots of airline pilots stayed there. We would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: Awthin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before and after a cruise to Alaska. We chose this hotel because we had stayed free using the points that we had earned from their loyalty programme. The room was large and well furnished. The best thing were the spectacular views from our huge window.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Peacher
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Seattle. We stayed at the Crowne Plaza on 6th and Seneca. Location was very convenient, only 3 blocks from the light rail to/from the airport. Was there with a group of docents from the Boise Art Museum. Our goal was to "OD" on art. We were only minutes away from Pioneer Square, SAM, the Frye, Pike Place Market. I organized much of this trip (for 27) and wanted a location close to the many art museums and galleries we wanted to visit. The Crowne Plaza fulfilled all our requirements. They also had a great breakfast spread and very comfy beds. We were on the 26th floor and had a great view of the Space Needle. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “OK in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: cujas
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near shopping, etc., but uninspiring amenities.

Reviews.Title: “They take care of everything...”
Reviews.Author: Aidy_Lady
Reviews.Content: We only stayed the one night as we were just popping down from Vancouver but loved the hotel and would defiantly stay again. Rooms: Huge and comfy rooms. We got an upgrade on arrival which is also brilliant. Very good value. Location: Very central and only a few blocks away from the shopping or the sea front with all their yummy restaurants. Service: From the moment we arrived they were extremely helpful. We were very disorganised and hadn’t booked dinner in a seafood restaurant we were hoping to go to or drinks in the space needle. I mentioned that I forgot to at the front desk to my boyfriend and the receptionist asked if she could help. We only made it up the room before we had a call from the concierge saying everything had been taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Ghamel
Reviews.Content: I was quite surprise when we got the the hotel the manager on duty did upgrade us to a higher floor where we had great view of the skyline and space needle. She did empathize with me about the fact that the address is not recognized in some GPS, bringing you in a residential neighbourhood instead of downtown Seattle. I wish they would have told me that when I made the reservation saving me a 30 minutes of chaos in a new city. Nonetheless, we had a great time and it was a walking distance from Pike Place Market. I am planning to go back with my boyfriend first week of November.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Rump4k
Reviews.Content: Great Customer Service: Arrived at (not-even) noon, and were allowed to check-in early. Flight home departed SeaTac at 3 pm, they allowed us to check-out late at 1 pm Nice, friendly and helpful staffs (front desk, room-service and valet) Great Location: Located in the center and within walking distance (15 minutes top) of all the places we wanted to visit in downtown Seattle. Going 3 blocks down to 3rd avenue, and you can ride buses for free if you don't feel like walking. Located right in the exit and entrance of highway. A plus for those who rent a car like us. Miscellaneous: Nice and comfy bed Nice view (from our room at high level floor) Minus one star because of high noise level from their old air conditioning system and I think that's the reason they give you a set of ear plug in their little welcome package. Overall... nice experience. Would recommend them to others and come back for our next visit to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: wrldtravlr345
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Crowne Plaza for a girls getaway shopping weekend. It was perfectly located within walking distance from Pike Market, downtown shopping and to our car rental. The hotel has a restaurant we had breakfast and dinner there. Service and food were great. Valet service was nice - a little pricey but understandable for downtown hotels - our car rental was the same price as to store our car! Our room was clean and spacious and we were happy it had a little fridge to store our water. I forgot my phone charger and I phoned the hotel and they had it and I told them I was from Canada - thinking it would be more of a hassle for them but they happily obliged. I received it today. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Seattle”
Reviews.Author: 4kristina
Reviews.Content: We were on the 24th floor in a suite with an amazing view of the Space Needle and skyline. Both rooms had this amazing view through big windows. It was also very clean.The front desk staff was so friendly and helpful. Had great sushi at Japonessa, recommended by front desk. Downhill walk to Pike's Market, the walk back to the hotel is a great leg workout. We tool the new rail in from the airport. Super easy, clean and a great way to go green. We exited at the University station and walked a few blocks to hotel with rolling bags, easy to do. Coffee place every block. Easy walk to downtown shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much value”
Reviews.Author: MaraInTO
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice looking hotel which we got for a reasonable price; however, we were surprised to find that other than a grand lobby, there are no amenities to speak of (no pool, no hot tub) and you have to pay for WIFI. Ridiculous. It is also located by a major highway and although we were on the highest floor we were overwhelmed with noise. Turning on the train-like AC system didn't help. We wondered why there were complimentary ear plugs in the room. I am not kidding; and, I had to use them. This hotel is suited for business travelers I imagine; but, as a family, it was not for us. Thankfully we were there for only one night. We were taking the Clipper the next morning - and, the staff messed up our taxi request. At 7am we were scrambling to find our way and I was not impressed! If you just want a bed, you sleep like a rock, and you get it for a good rate, then it might be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous view, great location, worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: bettibiz
Reviews.Content: I was in Seattle with my son for his 21st birthday, so I rented the club level suite. We were on the 32nd floor; incredible views of the Space Needle and Lake Washington. Everything was clean and well-kept, nice toiletries and plenty of space in the bedroom, living area, and bathroom. My only complaint was I had asked to have the sofa bed in the living area turned down, and it didn't get done at turn-down. I had to call, and the young man who came was polite enough, but had very little clue what I was saying as he didn't speak English. I didn't go into the club area the evening we arrived, although my son did and really enjoyed the food. We did go back for the breakfast the next morning and it was worth it. It's continental, so pastries, cold cereal, oatmeal, yogurt and fruit were all available; it saved us eating breakfast in the dining area. It was a quality, if impersonal, experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel did not release hold on funds until 3 days after they were paid, caused HUGE financial burden!”
Reviews.Author: Monica99203
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and some friends stayed at the Crowne Plaza in downtown Seattle for four days and three nights in August. We booked two rooms. The stay was great. We were in Seattle for PAX. While at the convention, we made numerous purchases. We had planned for this, and had set aside more than enough money for the trip. But when we checked out, the hotel charged our card, but did not release the hold they had put on the funds for the entire stay. Both rooms. This hold remained in place for THREE FULL DAYS after we had paid our bill. Because of this, we incurred 13 overdraft charges from our bank for insufficient funds! The funds were there, just held hostage by Crowne Plaza. My husband called the hotel to inform them of their mistake, and ask that our overdraft fees ($35 each!) be covered by them for not releasing the hold when we paid our bill (this is standard procedure). But he was told that this is THEIR standard procedure. REALLY?! Then why don't they inform their customers of this when they book the hotel so they can plan on having an extra couple of thousand dollars in their accounts if they are going to stay here. Is it because they know that the customers would choose to stay somewhere else?

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: rob3066
Reviews.Content: Located about 15 mins walk to the waterfront or Pike Place, although it is uphill returning to the hotel. Is close to a large highway (21 lanes of it), so there is some traffic noise. We were given a room on the 31st floor, an executive club room but that does apparently does not mean executive lounge access. I know when I booked the description included lounge access because I remember the breakfast being included, so after some discussion with the reception, we were granted access. Shame this happened! The rooms (bedroom, lounge & bathroom) were a little tired but nicely furnished with good views of the city & waters around. Coffee maker available and flat screen TV's x 2 In the ExecutiveLounge, you could buy alcohol, not sure but possible state intervention there, wine for example $7, whereas it was only $5 in the bar. Why more expensive in the Executive lounge? Small amount of canapies available from 5-7 pm . Breakfast complimentary in lounge, fresh fruit, bread products & cereal, nice selection! 5 min taxi ride to railway station. This is fine for downtown or the waterfront, but by no means the best Crowne Plaza out there. For an extra £10 per night, you could stay at the much better Fairmont Olympic, we did later in our holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Solo business traveler”
Reviews.Author: HamptonRoadsNative
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. My room, #2652, had good views of the Space Needle and downtown. A day before arrival, I checked the 'Specials' section on the hotel's website, and saw the 'Upgrade to Club Level' promotion. At check-in, the front desk staff seemed a little skittish about letting me use it, but got back to me a minute later, and said it was okay. Pros: Safe/good location, friendly staff, and (with 'Upgrade to Club Level') free computer/internet access in business center on 5th floor & free cont. breakfast, on 32nd floor. Cons: Not enough elevators for amount of guests/floors, which created slightly long waits. This is probably unavoidable, due to the sheer number of people who stay there before going on cruises.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Clareandken
Reviews.Content: We arrived after our 9 hour flight and were greeted by Dylan. He went out of his way to make us delighted on our honeymoon trip. The hotel room was spacious, and clean. The bathroom was cozy but had all the essentials. We have stayed in nicer Crowne Plazas decor-wise but have never experienced service like it! the hotel is perfectly located for Pike Place Market and walking distance from most attractions in the city. I would not hesitate to book this hotel again - the staff are a credit to IHG, the rooms were pleasant and the location was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: vpcomics
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my wife and son for four nights while we were attending the Penny Arcade Expo at the Convention Center in Aug. The absolute best thing about this hotel was the short walk (about 7 mins or so) to the Convention Center. Everything else about this hotel was pretty much average. The on site resteraunt is small but the buffet breakfast in the morning was a plus. The rooms were nice but having to pay everyday for internet access was a minus. The staff was profesional and did a good job giving me directions to various places when I asked them. Overall, I would only stay at this hotel again if I was attending another event at the Convention Center (or taking a cruise form the nearby port). If you plans include other destinations, I'd look for a less expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Big name, small mentality”
Reviews.Author: BojanLo L
Reviews.Content: Why do so many big name hotels have such a small mentality? They have you overpay for everything... no fridge or microwave, no free internet access... they expect you to love your stay because it's a Crown friggin' Plaza. Well, that's too bad. You simply pay too much for average service. The rooms in it self are pretty alright, the view from our room (facing the library) was great, the bed comfy. I just wish they would step it up.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel ,close to all amenities”
Reviews.Author: brendat54
Reviews.Content: great hotel , walking distance to great shopping and attractions

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CricketGirl2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights prior to an Alaskan cruise. Great location within walking distance to Pikes's Place and other tourist attractions on the waterfront. Many restaurants and fabulous shopping withing a couple of blocks as well. Just don't expect a 4 star hotel - I'm actually pretty shocked it is rated this high. Clean hotel, but quite dated. They have tried to compensate with newer furniture, but it doesn't hide the tiny bathrooms, ancient elevators, and old carpet. Also right next to the highway so half of the rooms only have views of the highway. Best hope you get lucky and have a city view... Expect to wait quite a while for an elevator if the hotel is busy - we once waited over 15 minutes. The elevator never did come, so we walked down 16 flights of stairs. We mentioned this to the front desk at checkout and there was no problem with the elevator, just a busy day. WOW. The service was excellent. Everyone always had a smile on their face, a pleasant greeting, and seemed to have a genuine desire for your stay to be a pleasant one. From the bellmen, to the front desk, to housekeeping, everyone we encountered was friendly and accomodating. The front desk even called about 15 minutes after we checked in to confirm that we were happy with our room and if there was anything we need. I thought this was a nice touch. Overall I do not think I would stay here again unless the hotel was remodeled, or if the price was considerably discounted.

Reviews.Title: “centrally located hotel for touring Seattle”
Reviews.Author: bbeerbower
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza is a exceptionally nice business type hotel in a great location for touring Seattle. It is close to light rail from SEA TAC airport (3 blocks uphill to hotel); Within walking distance of Pioneer Sq (5 blocks); Waterfront piers & state ferries (6 blocks downhill); Agrosky tours; Seattle Aquarium; Ivars Fish Bar; Pikes Place Market etc are within walking distance. There is a free bus system from 6am-7pm on 3rd Ave (2 blocks) which runs almost to the Seattle center & Westlake where you can get the Monorail $ to Seattle Center. The rooms were clean, beds comfortable; service excellent & very helpful concierge service which I expect from a 4 star hotel. breakfast may or may not be included in rate; paid parking. Internet is not free! Hotels are expensive in Seattle so you need to shop around. This hotel usually runs $200+ but you can find a good deal online. I paid $182 including taxes for 2 double beds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good value”
Reviews.Author: wayanedwin
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at the C Plaza for three nights in August and attended two Mariner games. The hotel is in a good location, however, not for those who have difficulty walking hills. We were only a short walk from great restaurants, bars and shopping. Cab's to and from the games were under $10.00. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT UP TO THE STANDARD OF A CROWN PLAZA HOTEL AND MORE LIKE A COMMON HOLIDAY INN HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: travelguy1944
Reviews.Content: NOTE: This hotel should only Have a Holiday Inn grading as it is really only a 3 star hotel. Definitely not up to the standard of a Crown Plaza. ROOMS: Very small and bathrooms are also very small. Shower is over the bathtub with a pull across curtain - most USA Crown Plaza hotels have this type of shower whereby you nearly break your neck trying to navigate stepping into the bathtub. The bathroom door is 4 ft. from the bed head and the toilet is approx 7 ft from the bed head. Difficult to get in and out of the shower as the bathroom is so small. When you flush the toilet it has exactly the same sound as aircraft toilets - Whoooosh!! Sure wakes you up if you flush at night. Bed is ok but the pillows are very small and uncomfortable - we asked housekeeping for larger pillows but they only had the one size. All of the suite rooms back onto all of the 4 lifts so you can expect some noise. The comfort package containes ear plugs! Don’t know what we would do if the fire alarm went off! Windows are not double glazed. The suite rooms are not worth the money as they are small and pokey and the bathroom is just so small. We had a suite which we paid full price for on the priorityclub.com booking site but it's definitely not worth anything like the price we paid which was US$263 per night plus 15.6% tax per night. BREAKFAST: Continental breakfast is provided at the club floor on the 32nd level. Very poor choice available and there is very limited seating. Only the one tray of chopped up fruit is available - not much room on the table for anything else except for a few croissants and buns. Very poor continental breakfast as the Holiday Inn Express hotels would have a much better continental breakfast than this, so, not up to the Crown Plaza standard. CLUB ROOM: Club room is on thr 32 floor and only open from 5pm to 7pm Sunday to Thursday plus also open for breakfast on these days. Only a greasy fat pizza plus one other warm finger food type available plus some chopped up fruit. Coffee/tea, water and fizzy type drinks available. No alchoholic drinks available unless you paid for them. Spirits $8, Beer $6 and glass of wine $9. So, don’t get excited if you get an upgrade to the club floor and don’t bother paying extra for access to the floor as it is not worth it. SECURITY: Reasonable security as you need your key card to operate the lift - we did not see any security guards on duty and the surveilance cameras were only in the receptioin area. POSITION: Good position and about 15 minutes walk to the Pike Street Farmers Market. TOURS: We did the city tour and the Boeing tour which were excellent as we used the tour operator as recommended by the concierge, Christian. These two tours were about the best ones we experienced in the USA as the tour guides were absolutely fabulous and very well informed. The name of the tour operator was "Tours Northwest". IN ROOM SAFE: In room safe was available but it was only affixed to the back of the cupboard and not affixed securely to the wall as per recommended installation instructions. I don’t know who wrote some of the other shining reports on this hotel but they must have been drinking their bathwater when they wrote them!! STAFF: Generally most of the staff were ok and fairly obliging

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located, Great Value, Perfect for Pre and Post Cruising...”
Reviews.Author: twinzmomie
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Friday and hit the ground running. The staff was very pleasant and held our bags until our rooms were ready. We were able to get to all the sites by foot. We stayed there before our Alaskan cruise that left on a Sunday morning. Seems that many cruisers choose this location. The room was a nice size and we had a lovely view. There were many places to eat nearby and of course Starbucks! We were so glad that we booked the hotel for an additional night post-cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rmb0707
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at Crowne Plaza. It is right off the highway from the airport. The rooms were nice and big. I thought the room rate was a little pricey but that is the trend nowadays. It had a nice HD TV inside with plenty of channels to choice from. I had a great view of downtown Seattle. We were on the fifteenth floor. I heard this hotel was steps away from pier 66. They were wrong. It was at least two miles away. You cannot walk it with luggage. We took the shuttle and it cost us $10 each. We were told there is a buffet, we assumed it was free but it cost $15 a person. We were only staying one night there before our Alaskan cruise.

Reviews.Title: “very well situated”
Reviews.Author: nine52
Reviews.Content: near shopping area, not too far by walking to Pike market, just beside the highway if you rented a car and a beautiful seaview if you are lucky to have a high level room. People are very nice and service is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good option if you get a deal”
Reviews.Author: GourmetTravellers
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Seattle are ridiculously expensive so if you can get a good internet deal, thats a bonus. We managed to do that for one night at the Crowne Plaza and were pleasantly surprised when upon check in, we were upgraded to a larger room, with a great view of the Space Needle. The room was clean, the bed very comfortable and there was a little 'pamper' pack waiting for us. Why do these large chain hotels charge for internet? We've stayed in many smaller hotels that offer free wifi and I find it hard to believe that larger hotels couldn't do the same. Surely these days, providing internet is like providing TV access, everyone wants it. Also, upon checking out, we asked the bell clerk where the taxi rank was and he just told us it was up the road. I would have thought for a hotel of this standard, he would have offered to call a cab for us or flag one down, instead of us having to drag our suitcases up over a busy intersection.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy place”
Reviews.Author: sweetpea57_12
Reviews.Content: Comfortable beds, great location. Totally walkable downtown and to waterfront. Glad we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Dana P
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the crown plaza in seattle we were greated with great desk clerks. They were very helpful. The room was fantastic!! Very clean with a wonderful view of the space needle. The Bed was also Fantastic I got a great night sleep! My only concern was the restaurant service was slow and the waiter was not friendly. it was a shame that on a saturday night that the restaurant was not filled with people, other than that I would definatly stay there again and would recommend this hotel to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tired feeling hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BeenerC
Reviews.Content: This hotel choice was a luck of the draw from a discount website. We stayed for one night at the tail end of a trip and wanted to explore Seattle. The hotel has a tiny lobby, and feels like a hotel with far fewer stars than it was rated. Our room was large, the beds were comfortable. I appreciated the earplugs, eye mask, lavender linen spray and curtain clip. These were all a part of the hotel's effort to ensure you get a good sleep. Jet-lag and an extended travel day ensured I slept fairly well. The earplugs were necessary because the A/C unit in the room was extremely loud. I actually got up in the night to increase the thermostat just so the A/C would turn off for a while. The room got stuffy, but at least it was quiet. The hotel appeared to have been built in the 60's or 70's and updated in the 90's or early 00's. It felt every year of it's age and the updating looked like a bad facelift which makes obvious that 'work' had been done. We stayed at a Super 8 in rural Alberta a year ago that seemed to share the same decorator. The staff was average in courtesy and hospitality. I will say, however, that the housekeeping was excellent. Our room was immaculate. I noticed many flight crew stayed at this hotel, and as a stop over on a trip, this hotel would serve well (at the discount rate only!). I would not recommend staying here for any sort of a romantic occasion. If traveling with a family, there was ample space in the room to set up a travel crib. Another oddity was the absence of Wi-Fi in the rooms. For the price they charge, this should be an included service. There was a business center with internet access, but that is hardly convenient. My husband managed to find an unsecured Wi-Fi access point from a nearby business if he sat next to our rooms window.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: sk9758
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel just for one night prior to taking my cruise from Seattle. I had booked two rooms and being a Priority Club Elite member, they upgraded one room to an executive suite with a connecting room with 2 double which made it perfect for us as a family. The location is near to everything but not really next to it as you need to walk a little bit. Not much of an issue. The hotel seems to be showing its age as you can notice when the lift creaks it was up . Check in was quick and the bell desk staff was happy to keep all of our luggage in the store room rather than taking it up to the rooms. Just as good because otherwise the rooms would have got cramped up for us. They even got for us a good private van to take us to the pier next day. Unfortunately the hotel was totally sold out so I could not get a high floor room and got one on the 10th floor - the rooms actually start from the 8th floor upwards. Again , as elite members, we were given free access to the Club lounge on the 32nd floor which had good views. We were able to partake in the regular continental breakfast next morning. There were no hot items of food there. Nevertheless, well appreciated. We did have dinner in the main restaurant on the second floor and the food was superb! Worth mentioning is the overall service of the staff in the hotel. Each and every one of them were so friendly and helpful. Luckily, next day I was able to check out from the room itself as it was a mess downstairs and the lobby overflowed with guest all checking out almost the same time - probably leaving for some cruise or the other.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaLaxman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights,via Victoria Clipper deal.My wife,son, and I,came to watch the Blue Jays play Seattle.Large rooms,hotel was centrally located for all we had planned. Conceirge and Bell Staff were always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: DMommy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza Seattle and it was wonderful! The staff was extremely helpful. I arrived at 11:30 a.m. and I had a 1:00 meeting; they checked me in early. The room was clean and the view was gorgeous. I slept peacefully on the comfortable bed. I ordered cobbler from room service and it was delicious! The only downside was no pool! I guess the weather in Seattle limits swimming but an indoor pool would be a great addition to this wonderful hotel. The only negative is the slow elevators. Airport service would also be a great addition.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfy room, good location and great perks for priority club member”
Reviews.Author: katieling
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights. Two of the nights were paid out of pocket under AAA rate and one night was a priority club reward. We arrived at 11pm and the check-in staff was prompt and friendly. I am a priority club platinum member. The clerk upgraded us to an executive suites on the 33rd floor with sweeping view of the downtown and the harbor. The room was comfy and spacious. The windows were spotless. Each night, the houskeeping staff placed a bottle of lavender scent bedsheets freshener on the bed. I ended up collect the bottles with us to treat the bedsheets in the hotels we stayed in the rest of the trip. We also had complimentary continental breakfast served on the 32nd floor . The breakfast has fruits, bagels, muffins, pastries, cereals , yogurts, juices, bottled water and sodas. The coffee was a little weak. Everyday, we took two bottles of water with us from the breakfast to drink around town. The location is not bad. But It is NOT in the middle of everything. It is within walking distance to Pike Place market, West lake Mall, waterfront and pioneer square. Be prepared to walk uphill from the waterfront back to the hotel. As one of the reviewer has pointed out, the elevators were slow and they hided behind the beams in the hallway that made it easy to miss them when they finally arrived your floor. We had waited for 12 minutes one time to get on a elevator. We didn't have a car with us when we toured Seattle since the parking was expensive at the hotel ( as well as in other hotels in downtown Seattle). It was $32 a night. But we found it pretty easy to get around in Seattle w/o a car. We went to Pike Place, water front, West Lake Mall, art museum, China Town, Pioneer Square on foot. We went to Olympic Park and Ballard Lock by bus. We went to Space Needle and Music Experience Project by monorail. Finally, we went to West Seattle on a ferry. The sunset view from West Seattle to downtown Seattle was awesome and not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean.”
Reviews.Author: pchess12345
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. they put us in a regular room on floor 26, the fire detector kept "chirping" so they offered to move us to a room on the 15 floor. We were like, no we are on vacation you are not penalizing us the view bc something is wrong with this room. The lady was not nice or working with us at all. So we just said forget it, we had dinner reservations for my birthday & decided we would deal with it when we got back. This time we stopped at the front desk and a guy assisted us & moved us to a room on floor 27, which was fine. My opinion is if you ever need assistance at a hotel go to the lobby front desk where other guest are so that they will assist you appropriately. Parking was very very expensive but probably normal for that area. Overall it was a nice stay for the week, we had no other issues. We ordered room service one night bc we were tired & it was good. we overlooked the interstate & i would assume it is louder on lower floors, we could still hear traffic but it was faint. They have a nice gift shop on the premise with lots of Seattle "stuff." We met several people that were staying one night & then leaving for an Alaskan cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of positives, one big negative”
Reviews.Author: Mkl66-03
Reviews.Content: We are a family of six and decided to spend a few days in Seattle. Since we are so many, I always need to booked two rooms; and therefore, price is always a factor, along with location, room size and cleanness. After reading the reviews posted on this hotel I decided to go with it. I must say the reviews were accurate. The rooms were large, clean, with very comfortable beds. Upon check-in they did some re-arranging so that we could have adjoining rooms; which was appreciated. I was a little leary at first, as our rooms were right next to the elevators, but not a problem at all, very quiet. Right next to I-5, so may be a little noisy on the lower floors, but we were on floor 33, so not a problem. Other reviews stated that the elevators were slow, but they must have had them serviced, as we did not wait any time at all for an elevator in our four day stay. Location was great. All sites are within walking distance as well as the free bus, for those who do not want to walk. So, the one negative? The restaurant. We were given a coupon at check-in for a discount on their breakfast buffet. The buffet was limit. Food was ok. Service was horrible. Then we get the bill. I was expecting a $72.00 bill. What I got was a $97.00 bill. They had charged us 18% gratuity for being a party of six and on the original price, not the discounted price. I am not a fan of the mandatory service charge as it is, but at least charge me on the $72.00, that was the price for my breakfast! I would also like a little service as well for the mandatory charge. When I asked about it the staffs only answer was, "The computer automatically does it." We ate at a different restaurant the following day and had a coupon as well; we were charged the 18% gratuity for being a party of six, but the 18% was added after the discount. Much more tolerable. Except for the restaurant all was great. If you decide to stay, enjoy the room and location and steer clear of the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Physical Hotel, Employees Not So Much”
Reviews.Author: msim42
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the hotel, but was taken aback at the lack of professionalism by the staff. Felt like I was to be punished for interrupting their personal phone calls/conversation, then made to feel embarassed because I did not have a credit card to check in with. The room was prepaid, so i assumed they could turn off the incidentals. I would have been more than happy to find an ATM for a cash deposit, but their attitude towards us is what turned us off. I even felt like I was bothering the concierge when I asked for directions, then had to clarify her instructions. Sorry - not accustomed to being treated in this manner, so we will not be back. Hotel management might want to look at branding or customer service classes for front line personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrSunshine777
Reviews.Content: There were a lot of little quirky things about this hotel, such as the elevator lights hidden by the hallway doors, but overall a nice place to stay. The hallway walls blocked your view of the elevator lights, so it was possible to wait for an elevator, have one come and go, and still be waiting. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and some were very nice. Spring for the higher floor, concierge room if you can swing it.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to deal with useless staff”
Reviews.Author: kitten2Australia
Reviews.Content: Condition of hotel is as expected for the price paid, so no complaints there but the reception staff here have turned uselessness and not communicating into a new science. Despite having spoken English as my first language for my entire life, I think I had an easier match communicating with hotel staff in Europe. It's as if they go out of their way to misunderstand what you are saying, and when the message finally makes its way across, they're really good at passing the buck to other staff members. Our luggage did not arrive with us on our flight to Seattle, and although that is no fault of the hotel or staff, the front desk staff were less than helpful with facilitating its eventual delivery to the hotel, in one instance telling someone who had phoned for us that we were not staying at the hotel when we in fact were, and when the luggage did finally arrive, we were not notified despite being told quite tersely that we would be. When we asked at the front desk we were told very dismissively that there had been no deliveries, and had we believed that we would have unknowingly left Seattle with our baggage still in the hotel due to the lack of ability on behalf of the hotel staff to communicate with us and each other. If the staff were at least friendly, their incompetence could be excused. Aside from this though, Terry the Concierge was fantastic and was streets ahead of the front desk staff, and the location of the hotel is very convenient, as is the free breakfast on the 32nd floor for the rates that include it. If you can pack some spare time, do so because this hotel has won the award for slowest elevators in history! Perhaps it is set up that way to provide you with more time to deal with the frustration towards the front desk staff before you get to your room...(?)

Reviews.Title: “Expectations met, not exceeded”
Reviews.Author: froboy4196
Reviews.Content: I would use "good" to describe most aspects of the Crowne Plaza Seattle: good location, good hotel, good room, good price. However, nothing about the hotel really stands out, except for the very slow elevators (you'll find yourself waiting several minutes at least once during your stay). Also, the hotel is located near the top of a hill, so you'll be walking down as you leave and then up as you come back. Otherwise, this is a "good" property without much to distinguish it. But it is very serviceable for a stay near the heart of Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Service, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Mar5hall
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotwire and got an amazing deal of around $100 last summer. They upgraded us to one of the top floors and the view was incredible. Location wise, it's great for walking around, as it's right downtown. Rooms were modern and very clean. Bed was extremely comfortable as well. The service was great. Having booked through hotwire before, past experience has showed me that sometimes hotels treat you a little differently. This was not the case for Crowne Plaza Seattle. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Really great view of downtown”
Reviews.Author: Kris13wolfe
Reviews.Content: Really nice staff, clean room, comfy bed, good water pressure. We stayed on the 29th floor and the view was beautiful! Send it to my husband and he said it looked like a post card. Ate dinner here once. Beef stroganoff was just ok. Tried to eat breakfast here but the waiter left us sitting there a long time. Their breakfast is rather overpriced $16 for the buffet and overpriced a la carte items. Wifi is $10 a day, or $40 for the week. Thank goodness for 3G.

Reviews.Title: “A good downtown location”
Reviews.Author: jred922
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close enough to walk to many of the downtown attractions..something that is a VERY good idea given the crazy traffic in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room for the Price”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior2_11
Reviews.Content: IHG is my preferred hotel chain, and since there was not an Intercontinental I stayed at the Crowne Plaza. The location is downtown. Check-in was efficient and keys were available at time of check in at 1PM. They upgraded me to the Club Floor and informed me this was a secure floor. I asked if it would be possible to move me to a lower floor because I had interviews coming the entire next day. They unfortunately said they were sold out and didn't have any rooms but when my guests arrived that all I had to do was call down and they would give them a pass. Since I am from the East coast my stomach was on EST. I was hungry around 330PM and called for room service. They informed me that they could not do dinner service until 5PM but if I called back in 40 minutes they would handle the request. I called back, and they took my order and the food was delivered within 20 minutes. The club floor room was spacious and well appointed. For the price of 110.00 I felt it was an excellent and fair price. Internet was free with an access code. I am not sure if I was given this due to my status or if everyone got free access. Pretty simple access code though. "priority" After having dinner and relaxing I tried to stay on EST and fell asleep by 7PM. The one bad experience was the club room was only 50 feet from my room. I could hear people talking, laughing and having a good time most of the evening. The club room is not enclosed, so all sound traveled throughout the club floor. I was awake by 3AM and decided to see if they could possibly move me to a different floor. I explained the noise issue and the clerk 1st said they were sold out. I expressed my concern with the noise and persisted and she said she would see what she could do. Low and behold there was a room available! I moved to the lower floor (19) which was not as well appointed, but was still acceptable. The one thing to keep in mind is this hotel has 32 floors with 3 elevators. I am not sure if 1 or more of the elevators were always out of commission, but I usually had to wait a minimum of 5 minutes for an elevator. They pushed the breakfast in a large number of advertisments throughout the hotel so I decided to try it. The buffet was limited and service was fair. But for the price of 11.95 (which I negotiated at time of payment) was an acceptable price. The hotel does have a gift shop that has a wide variety. I forgot my belt in the hotel the night before in a different city and was worried I would have to go without a belt for my meetings/interviews. The gift shop had belts, ties, etc and saved me! Overall - the hotel is more than acceptable, comfortable and a good bargain. (FYI - valet parking was 39.95/night)

Reviews.Title: “Most Pleasant and Positive Surprise”
Reviews.Author: InsiemeSempre
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out, our experience over three nights was most pleasant and positive despite the hotel being super busy. We could not have been assigned a more panoramic upper floor room to introduce us to Seattle by the highly professional but warmly personable staff. The room itself was spotlessly clean, the beds very comfortable, the robes a delight (as were the linens and towels), and the bathroom amenties (always a gauge of a hotel's real devotion to hospitality) brought a welcome smile. There was also a novel first for us: the presence of a clip on one curtain to ensure a seamless joining. Well done, Crowne Plaza! What further impressed us was being granted a late check-out despite the property being fully booked, our room being actually readied one day in the two hour window we had requested for that day, the restaurant having fine food with engaged servers, the Club Lounge continental breakfast fare was solid but unpretentious, and both of us (marvel of marvels!) were greeted by name after just a few hours on the property. Well done, Crowne Plaza!! The property is well maintained and one gets a feeling of security by the number of staff at all hours of the day and evening. By the way, it is a lovely walk from the hotel to Pike Place Market, central shopping, the nearest Seattle-ubiquitous Starbucks is two blocks, and the delightful water-infused Freeway Park is just across the street.
