Would we stay there again? You bet. As a matter of fact, our upcoming Alaska cruise will originate now out of Seattle rather than as previously planned out of San Francisco. Thanks, Crowne Plaza!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - poor service!”
Reviews.Author: Kennethtravelling
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel at a very good location with everything within a (short) walking distance. Got a room in 20th floor with a very nice view. Was told at check in that valet parking was USD. 22,- pr. night and they charged USD. 32,- and had no interest in changing that. Very arrogant staff in the front desk. And again, with the "big" chains, they will charge you USD. 10,- for WIFI! Not good!

Reviews.Title: “Average stay, no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: New2TravelingAgain
Reviews.Content: We had an easy check in. We had 7 rooms booked for a company/family vacation that we had booked through Priceline. Upon check in they upgraded us all to the Club Level, which is normally an additional $30 per night. It basically gave us access to a continental breakfast. The room was alright, the bed was pretty comfortable. We checked out the room service menu and the prices were pretty high for a hamburger. We lucked out because next door was a Subway. When we checked out myhusband had left his Houston Astros jacket behind and we were boarding a cruise ship so we couldn't turn back. When we got home I contacted the hotel and within a week I had a box on the doorstep with the jacket in it. I appreciated the customer service they extended to us in helping us get the jacket back. We are staying at a Crowne Plaza in Houston next weekend and can only hope for the same level of hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: K8ellen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the CP for 6 nights. The rooms were adequate and clean but nothing out of the ordinary. The bed however was very comfortable and I loved the pillows! We were on the 15th floor and the traffic noise was loud. I've read reviews from others who received some type of comfort package with earplugs and sleep masks but we did not get anything like that. I found the hotel staff to be pleasant and helpful although housekeeping was somewhat lacking as my coffee and supplies weren't refilled every day and I had to ask for them at the front desk. The lobby was okay but it was small and I do prefer larger ones. I also wish there had been coffee available in the lobby as I've found in many other hotels. We were not happy that there was an added charge for wireless access as the room cost was high enough. The location was great and we were able to walk to almost everything although some streets are very steep! We were in Seattle for a convention and the hall was just a short walk through the park. We took the light rail from the airport and the train station was just a few blocks away so we were able to save on the cost of taxis. There are a lot of restuarants within walking distance also but check them out as some are very pricey!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeaThyme4me
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable and room was very quiet at night. Stayed on the 24th floor, but lower floors heard more traffic noise. Within one mile to Pike Place Market and Pioneer Square and were able to walk to them. The view from the room was of other buildings and the freeway and you could see the mountains between them. If you want a view, not a good choice. Hotel did not have a pool and the bathrooms needed updated greatly. The food in the Regatta Grille was good and the service was acceptable. Nothing outstanding. The elevators are exceptionally slow.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything in downtown seattle”
Reviews.Author: brucejkirch
Reviews.Content: I have come here the last 3 years to run the rock and roll marathon in June. I love stayinG here! The staff is wonderful and the has great views! I will be backmformyear 4 next year!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with beautiful city views”
Reviews.Author: SuzieK_GA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the CP two days prior to our Alaskan cruise and really enjoyed our stay. We had a two room suite (LR/Bedroom) and both rooms had wonderful views of the Space Needle and the downtown area. There was a continental breakfast on one of the top floors for Priority Club members and we were very pleased with the selection. Again, we had a beautiful city and mountain view - it was the perfect place to sit back drink your coffee and enjoy the snow covered mountains. After our cruise, our flight wasn't until 10:30 p.m. that night so we asked the CP folks if we could run our luggage back to the hotel for the day so we could roam around the city until time to head to the airport. NO PROBLEM! They were very accomodating. We loved Seattle and will be booking another stay at the Crowne Plaza in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location with incredible views!”
Reviews.Author: branderson59
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. It had a great location, the staff was great, the room was incredible with a breathtaking view of the Space Needle. We loved the restaurant as well. I will never stay anywhere else when I visit Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, hated this hotel”
Reviews.Author: smartlabelprint
Reviews.Content: We could hear everything from our neighbors under the door. To be fair we were there as part of a comic book convention and we should have thought of the type of teenagers, etc. that would be there at the same time. I think odd numbered rooms face the highway and it was HORRIBLY noisy. We complained and were switched sides and it was very nice for sleeping. On the other side of the hotel the ear plugs they provided weren't enough to help me sleep! We'll not stay here again. We were in a high numbered room and the highway noise was still horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Always Consistent”
Reviews.Author: KirD
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times and have always been pleased. Good highway access and easy walking to area restaurants or waterfront including light rail.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: tammynnc
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at Intercontinentals but sadly none in Seattle. So, I had an overnight at this hotel and was very pleased! Much better than the average CP's I have stayed at in the states. Location is good, sea-tac is convenient and area around the hotel is nice (but more hilly than I was expecting for some reason) Hotel is beautiful. The staff were friendly and a couple of people in particular seemed to go out of their way to help out. I am PC Platinum and was upgraded and it was very nice. Got in just in time for evening snacks and cocktails on the Club floor. My room was comfortable with a stunning view. Overall much better than I was expecting!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great service”
Reviews.Author: pasowine
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Crown Plaza many times and have always had an excellent experience. It is conveniently located in downtown on Seneca between 5th and 6th Avenues, with easy access to I-5 and also the Rail to the airport (at 3rd and Seneca). The front desk is always positive and ready to help. The rooms are very clean, well-kept, and quiet. If you get a room high enough (above the 10th floor or so), all the rooms have quite nice views as well. The lobby is smaller than most, but since I don't spend much time there, it wasn't an issue.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: IMarriedBob
Reviews.Content: I go to Seattle monthly and stay at the Crowne about 60% of the time. It's a nice hotel with a really friendly staff. For being downtown, the location is really great. You can walk to everything. (mind you, that you'll have to walk up and down a hill to get to Pike's Market and it is quite steep). You are 2 blocks off the major shopping street. It is worth paying to be on the club level; you get access to the upper floor where they provide appetizers at night and breakfast in the morning. Very convenient for regular, business travelers who don't care about eating out at different restaurants every day/night or people who want to save money. Beware that parking is very expensive. But, it's like that everywhere in downtown Seattle. The workout facility is adequate. The hotel has provided me amneties when I've lost them at the airport (toothpaste, deodorant). Bathrooms are a little dated but they are clean and nice (and appropriate for the price.) Staff is very friendly. They offer a business center with internet but there's a fee and it's fairly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great rooms, Great service”
Reviews.Author: AN1987
Reviews.Content: I was instantly impressed with the service of the staff- not only were they friendly but they were very accommodating! We were there with another couple and we both had rooms with a great view overlooking Seattle! The only thing that I would have to complain about was lack of free wifi for paying patrons. I think that this day and age it should be a given. $20/day is a little steep. There is a free business center provided for guests- and it even has a free printer. This was great- but wifi would have been even better. We WILL be back - we absolutely loved the whole experience and I was tempted to take home one of the pillows because it was so darn comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - can walk to all”
Reviews.Author: bgrs2go
Reviews.Content: Flew up for a day of shopping with my Mom. Hotel is nice & clean and comfortable beds. We had a great view of the Space Needle. Cute little night package that includes an eye mask, ear plugs and a linen lavender spray. I thought it was a nice touch! You can walk to everything. So many shops and places to eat. We did eat at Tulio's around the corner and it was delicious! Fresh Halibut and wonder waiters. Do try if you have time. The lobby is small, but they have a computer out there where you can print your boarding pass. Very handy. And to get back to the airport take the Downtowner airporter $15. instead of a taxi which is $40. They can arrange that for you. I enjoyed my first visit to Seattle and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but there are better hotels in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: PJMS_11
Reviews.Content: As I mentioned, this is a nice enough hotel and the staff were helpful and friendly, but I've stayed at much nicer hotels for about the same price in downtown Seattle. Rooms are a little small and could use some updating. We didn't visit the restaurant or bar (based on the reviews I had read), and they were pretty empty. We'll probably stay elsewhere on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: globell
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at Crowne Plaza. It was just easy. No hassles, no complaints, great service and very comfortable linens/bed = great nights rest. There was even 2 different thickness of pillows (which is awesome!), eye masks, ear plugs (in case the hint of city noise bothers you) and linen refresher spray. Service at the bar was just ok....hense why I dropped a notch on the service review but otherwise a wonderful, comfortable stay! Will stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; staff was friendly, but not helpful”
Reviews.Author: savetheredheads
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a convention and stayed here at the convention's recommendation. This property is very tall, but pretty small. The lobby area is pretty small and the guest room halls are tiny. Fortunately, our room was at the end of the hallway, but there are rooms that are DIRECTLY across from the elevator, so be mindful to ask for a room away from them or else you'll hear all 6 elevators running all night long. The property is in very nice condition and my room was very nice. I was on the 21st floor with a nice view over the city (including freeway). The room was very quiet - in fact, I was worried that the noise from my TV would disturb the neighbors. The rate that I booked was very fair ($92) and I feel that was the right value for this property. The convention center is only 3 blocks away, but be forewarned that it's downhill from the hotel, so at night when your feet are tired, you'll be trudging UP the hill. The surrounding location (like any big city) is hit or miss. My only real concern was that the YWCA is on the same short block, so there were women who looked pretty strung out and homeless chain smoking on the curb late into the night. They never asked for money or made me feel unsafe, but for what it's worth, it's not a great idea for ladies to venture alone late at night. The YMCA is only a block away and the Subway (sandwiches) immediately next door to the hotel attracts a lot of transient people well into the night (I don't know if it's a 24 hr location, but the restaurant was open very late). Again, I wasn't bothered by anyone but it's something to be aware of. The cons, for me, about this property: * no 24 hour doorman or security. I was out late one night and at 2am, there was only one lady working the check in counter and no one else in sight. * no keycard needed to enter hotel - the lobby area is open to the public and even the side entrances don't require keycards. Only the upper "club" floors require keycard access in the elevator, meaning that anyone can walk in off the street into the hotel. I didn't see it happen, but I don't feel safe when hotels don't have a security policy * the Concierge wasn't helpful. I spoke with 2 different concierges (at different times) and neither seemed to know the area well. I was looking for a bagel place and a burger place and neither had any suggestions. One recommended a bakery, which was good but didn't make bagels and the other recommended a chain sports bar for a burger. Both were decent suggestions, but as the Concierge, it's your job to know your city a little better and make recommendations. I took a quick look on Yelp and found the best burger in the city was only a few blocks away (try BOKA). * the Concierge also wasn't familiar with city transportation, so I ended up being recommended to take a taxi to the airport. The taxis are supposed to have a flat rate from downtown of $32 but this property doesn't qualify, so it was $48 + tip to get to SEA-TAC * the in-house restaurant food was just plain bad. I didn't have a room service menu in my room, so I walked down to the restaurant, who then referred me to the bar. Everyone was thoroughly perplexed on how to create a "to go" order (I would have been fine with room delivery, but they said no). Food was done fast, but it was all pre-made stuff (salad dressing from a jar, frozen burger patty, etc.). The price was fair, since I ordered it in the bar ($2 cheaper than the restaurant) but I wouldn't eat there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel With Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: skyguyWI
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Crowne Plaza-downtown Seattle for years whenever I travel to Seattle. The downtown location is perfect. The hotel is spotless, and the rooms are among the most comfortable hotels rooms I have ever experienced. As if that weren't enough reason to stay at the Crowne Plaza, there is one member of the front desk staff who has always welcomed me as though she is welcoming a guest into her home. It is the most wonderful experience, especially on the few times I've arrived at the hotel at 1:00 AM after a long day of traveling. Even though she sees me only once or sometimes twice a year, she always remembers me. The only thing that would make this hotel better would be a sauna, whirlpool, and swimming pool. However, the downtown YMCA is only a short walk away and offers daypasses for about $10. I would recommend the Crowne Plaza-downtown Seattle without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but dated”
Reviews.Author: Jock76
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night in October 2010 while attending a conference. The room was very dark and there was some construction work going on that affected my bathroom which wasn't very nice. There was no safety deposit box, which is useful when traveling with a lap top. The staff were polite and friendly but there was long wait to check in and out, despite there only being a couple of people waiting. The breakfast buffet was ok but had been sitting out for a while. This hotel is fine for a quick overnight but isn't one I would recommend for a leisure break.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful sleep”
Reviews.Author: fargovespa
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff, very clean and comfortable room . The bed was perfect. We were upgraded to a suite, which had a wonderful view. The location was perfect for walking to 5th Avenue Theater and for checking out the Seattle flower and garden show, which we found about it, from a sign that was advertising it in the lobby. Breakfast was very good. A very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: irasocol
Reviews.Content: We had a great room with a fabulous view and the downstairs staff was great, from valet parking to doormen to desk. And the duvets, well, you'll sleep well. But housekeeping couldn't bother to restock the simplest things, and when I asked room service to bring us some ice with a meal (my spouse was sick and I needed to ice an injured knee) the guy on the phone simply refused - this is service I've gotten at any other hotel I've stayed at. Plus internet is expensive and inconsistent, and you can't even find a room service menu unless you pay to be online. There are great things about the hotel, but I think we'll try elsewhere next visit to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, Great location and nice bar”
Reviews.Author: banddtravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by another couple. We went for a baseball game. It was a few blocks up the hill but once you made it to the water you were in walking distance from everything but the Space Needle. I would spring the extra money for a room with a view - the view was awesome. We ate breakfast at the hotel and it was good. We also finished each night with a night cap in the hotel bar - very nice relaxing place to enjoy each others company. Only warning is check in was crazy. We got into town at 3:00pm, check in was not till 4:00. and they would not accommodate us early. No problem we just drove around and checked the city out, when we cam back at 4:00 the lobby was a mad house. I would still stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay there”
Reviews.Author: WizOfOzCph
Reviews.Content: Its no better than staying at a highway motel. The noise from the traffic on I-5 is massive, The hotel is right next to the I-5 and many exits and a firestation. The waterpipes are squeking and you'll spend hours of wating for the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “High service hotel near the centre”
Reviews.Author: NWIFlyer
Reviews.Content: With the introduction of the light rail service from Seatac, this hotel is easily connectable from the airport, being only three blocks from the University Street station. Arriving after a 12 hour flight and towards the end of a 24-hour day, the staff were exceptionally friendly, knowledgeable, and took an interest in why I was staying and where I was from. As a Priority Club Gold member, I was ungraded to a Club Room suite (with a wonderful view over downtown Seattle), so got a reasonably comprehensive cold buffet breakfast included. My corporate rate also entitled me to free internet - which would otherwise have been a fairly expensive addition. Although PC members are entitled to a late check-out if capacity allows, the hotel was extremely busy yet this was granted without question. Later collecting the bags I left in storage for the afternoon, the receptionist remembered me and asked how her recommendations had worked out - a mark of very high standards of customer care. Crowne Plaza's are not the cheapest hotels, yet I would have no hestitation in spending my own money in staying here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: Bodeen72
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for business or pleasure. Three blocks from light rail, very walkable. Attentive staff, very clean and modern. Nice lounge/bar area, not overly noisy during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “This place is great - fast internet, quiet, clean, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Rimska
Reviews.Content: Finally a hotel with fast internet! Everything else was fine, too! And you know from my other reviews that I'm picky. I especially liked the comfortable office-type chair for working at the desk. I slept fine and the view of the surrounding skyscrapers close upon the location was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, clean, Comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: DofSales
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, comfortable, fitted king bed sheet didn't fit too well, had to be re-made daily (poor maid) TV didn't work in the room I was origionally assigned to, so was moved to a comperable room. The Maintenance man actually delivered the new keys, and key packet immediately for me. Elevators were quick, room service was quick, not the best quality room service food I've eaten, and a bit pricy, but not bad. I don't mind paying the price if it's good, know what I mean? Slept well, bed was comfortable. Didn't want to pay for the internet, but had to for one day, when I couldn't read a report on my blackberry. I hate paying for internet. Parking was expensive, but it is the city, and expected, so no big deal, valets were quick, but overly friendly. Overall, the staff was mediocre, with a little more polish, would make the stay a lot more comfortable, everyone seemed a bit down, and forced smiles. Being in the hotel business, I can spot unhappy staff a mile away. Other than that, would stay again, as the price was great for the city, clean, well maintained rooms (except the calbe in one room and fitness machine in fitness center)just need to work on staff morale. Fitness center was nice, good machines and equipment, unfortunately, one machines cable was severed, and not repaired in 5 days, (an easy fix) and one of the others squeaked really bad.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD Location - Average Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Pepchoo
Reviews.Content: Normally we stay outside of city to avoid expensive parking fees but decided we wanted to see city @ X-mas and go to Seahawks game so we decided on the Crone Plaza. I have to say besides the location - everything else was average or less. The room was small and had a musty-odor. They put us next to ice -machine (which didn't work) and just outside elevator which made our rest "noisy" .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fishman620
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on Hotwire for this hotel. Good Downtown location, right around the block from the 5th Avenue Theatre, 3 blocks away from Westlake Center, where you can catch the monorail to the Seattle Center. They upgraded us to the 29th floor and a room with a view. The rooms were a little older but well appointed. The Regetta Bar and Grille had decent prices for food and a happy hour. We could hear the conversation of the people next door to us, so the rooms are a little noisy. You do have to pay for parking, we paid $32 plus 20% tax. But I would not hesitate to stay here again because of the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay visiting downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: pkphilip
Reviews.Content: I will breakup this review based on the 6 categories of Tripadvisor: The hotel is clean, from the lobby, elevator, hallway to the room. It is very clean and almost spotless. We are surprised to see that our room is in excellent shape; obviously it is well maintained and well kept. The location is excellent, it is minutes of walk from the major shopping centers, Pike Place Market. I would have to say this hotel can cover many of the popular places in downtown. The room quality is excellent, we were given two queen beds. The room comes with a 32" TV, a desk, a mini-fridge, wireless internet with a relatively quiet AC. The wireless internet did not work, and we had to call front-desk for a password instead. Another problem with the room is that by the next morning, the windows is full of condensation when the room temp is kept at only 15C. Service is great as well, our hair-dryer is broken. We were given another one in about 15 min after calling the front desk. Since our room is prepaid and check-in and out are very quick. We haven't use any of the services so I cannot comment on others. We get this hotel by random as we bid this online. Value wise I have no other comments except excellent! Sleep qualility is great too, I was able to get at least 8 hours of sleep. The bed and pillow is firm enough that they don't sag. Overall, we are very happy with Crowne Plaza. I stayed in their Lake Oswego and was happy with it. The only concern I have would be the high price on parking. There are a few parking garage nearby that can provide overnight parking for a few dollars less and street parking is free on Sat after 6pm and Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel to return to”
Reviews.Author: Andreassn
Reviews.Content: The Crown Plaza Seattle gives you the feeling that every guest is special. From the moment you check in until you check out. The staff at the front desk and at the Regatta Restaurant are very friendly and service minded. Russ at the front desk makes sure that you feel very special as a guest. I would definately return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodation at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Chicagotraveler83
Reviews.Content: I took a trip to Seattle for a weekend in September with my wife and some friends and stayed in the Crowne Plaza. We were looking for an inexpensive place to stay in downtown Seattle with a good location and clean/comfortable accomodations. We booked the Crowne Plaza through Hotwire for a great place and were pleasantly surprised. The location was very central to lots of great restaurants and shopping and the room was very clean on comfortable - exactly what you would expect for any Crowne Plaza. My only complaint would be that the hotel was a little bit dated but given the price this was not a big deal. Defintely no complaints - would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'm glad we got a discount, because full price would have been too much.”
Reviews.Author: mtgops
Reviews.Content: The Crown Plaza Seattle bills itself as a high end, full service hotel. Although this may be true and the hotel is similar to its competitors in this respect, I can’t say that CPS is worth what the regular rate is for a room per night. Like most metro hotel locations you are paying for location and branding, certainly not for special perks, free services, free parking or other things I think are necessary to justify a premium price from a hotel. Normally I would not choose to stay at a high-end location such as this on my own dime, however I had a discount available to me, which made the price of the room hard to beat. Upon arriving you are met by pleasant, but visually overworked doormen and bellhops looking to earn a tip. The staff at the front desk is especially courteous, however a computer snafu befuddled the front desk clerk for a few minutes, causing them to ask for the spelling of my name a number of times over and over again and at least one phone call to a supervisor to find my reservation. Crisis averted and reservation found, the clerk returned to her previous calm self and finished my check-in. I had specified a single king bed room, however I was given a 2 double bed room. That didn’t matter too much. It was a corner room with an excellent view of I-5 and the west side of Downtown Seattle. I realized why the corner room also had 2 beds, it was because the non-corner rooms in the hotel are too small for 2 queen beds. The room had the normal toiletries, coffee maker and magazines and guidebooks to the local area. There was also a packet containing some aromatherapy spray, a sleep mask and earplugs. On each of the drapes was a clip, branded as part of the hotel’s “sleep assurance” program. I definitely liked the idea and wished that other hotels offered the same thing. The biggest issue with the corner room was the noise from I-5. Oh, never mind, that wasn’t the biggest issue; it was the mattress. The mattress was horrible. The worst I’ve ever slept on in any 4+ star hotel. Every time I rolled around a spring made a pop or whine noise and by morning, my wife and myself were both glad to be done with the night and glad we weren’t sleeping on this bed another night. I was also surprised about the towels. Towels in places like this are typically very plush and generally nice to use. However all of the towels in the room were thin and harsh to use. These towels were worthy of a Motel 6 or Super 8, but not a Crown Plaza. The towels were clean and bright white, but a location of this caliber should have had much better linens. Bed linens weren’t much better. I have nicer sheets at home and I purchased them from Costco. In general the Crown Plaza Seattle left me with mixed feelings. If the place was a 3 star property or lower, then the mattress, towels and bed linens would have been excusable, however that just isn’t the case. A high-end downtown property that prides itself in being a 4-star or better location should do much better in all the above areas.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at Crowne Plaza Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: shopaholicinvan
Reviews.Content: We had a girl's weekend shopping through Seattle and my friend booked Crowne Plaza Seattle (CPS) on Hotwire for a one night stay in June. There are numerous problems with this hotel. My friend forgot her toothpaste and since Crowne Plaza offers complimentary travel accessories, my friend called front desk. This was around midnight and the phones kept ringing and ringing. She then called concierge, again, it kept ringing. No answer at the valet desk either. We tried again in 10 minutes and again, no one answered their phones. Same went for the next morning when we tried calling valet. We called back 10 minutes to hear an out of breath valet answering the phone. There's only one attendant on duty at 9am? The bathroom also lacked a fan so the room became quite muggy. The tile used in the bathroom was also slippery; be careful if you step out of the shower. There also wasn't a place to hang your towels; only the shelve above the toilet (which isn't the most sanitary location). CPS also had slow elevators. It took over 10 minutes to finally hail an elevator from Ground Floor. There are only two serviceable elevators and while we were waiting, we came across the hotel manager who gave up after 5 minutes and left after we commented to him that the elevator is slow. This was especially a problem around dinner time when there were 30 people waiting in the lobby for the elevator. We gave up and sat in the lobby to wait until the crowds cleared. On the issue of parking, you also had to valet your car with Crowne Plaza as there wasn't an option to park it yourself. This service took a while as well. After our stay, my friend wrote in to Crowne Plaza Seattle to inform them of the problems encountered during our stay. She sent her email in twice and we still have not heard back from management since her emails in JUNE 2010. They say that word of mouth can make and break a business, well, Crowne Plaza Seattle, not only have you lost our business but you have also lost the potential business of all our friends as well.

Reviews.Title: “Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: FarWest_7
Reviews.Content: It was a nice and quiet hotel. The down side was that internet was 9.99 a night.

Reviews.Title: “expensive but had a great view.”
Reviews.Author: pinkroses2186
Reviews.Content: This hotel charges an arm and a leg for the room and then adds on $36 for parking, overall we paid $215 dollar to stay one night, and that was a major discounted rate. The hotel is very nice, clean, and queit, but did not have any free extras like a pool, breakfast or parking. Overall I would rate the hotel a 5 out of 10 becuase it was a nice room but expensive and didn't add on the extras for free.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with no catches.”
Reviews.Author: Tributton
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crown Plaza over Easter weekend. I needed a somewhat larger room since I was traveling with a companion or two and needed some extra space between myself and them. I was upgrade complimentary to a suite, which was very nice. The staff obviously knew of my needs and were happy to accommodate them. The room itself was lovely with a plush bed. I liked the lavender linen spray. We took advantage of the hot breakfast in the morning, which was really great and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “There's nothing wrong, but nothing right either”
Reviews.Author: anneVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Hotwire for a family trip (my husband and 20 month old son). We were not in the right kind of place for a toddler. Starting with the mandatory $37 hotel valet parking, we knew we were probably not in the right kind of hotel. The valets were friendly enough, but considering we had a stroller in the car we needed access to, it was a pain. The hotel lobby and rooms are a-ok, but there is nothing special about them. I will say the bed is cozy and comfy, but the room felt very business-oriented. It has two phones, a desk and many cords for a toddler to yank on! There isn't even a mini fridge in the room. Breakfast in the hotel was disappointing, not to mention the only highchair in the place was broken! We would have been better off heading to Pike Place Market and getting coffee, fresh fruit and baked goods. The hotel is fine, but just not for families with young children. We'll check reviews here more carefully before booking blindly next time!

Reviews.Title: “Crown is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: espinc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the CP Seattle over the weekend and it was great! Location is central to the downtown area and parking is not a hassle. We parked at the garage a block away for a few bucks less per day. The walk down to Pioneer Square and the downtown area is ok but the walk back up the hill is tough for some. The staff was excellent and professional, the room clean, and the view was good too. The bar was great for watching football. I left my laptop in the room and they were HUGE in returning it quickly - kudos to Housekeeping and the gentleman who found it. I am truly grateful! I recommend this hotel for any reason and at any time of year.

Reviews.Title: “great business hotel - top location”
Reviews.Author: bbarnucz
Reviews.Content: i've been to the crowne plaza seatle downtown many times in 2007 - 2009 on my business trips. i enjoyed the central location of the hotel, the nice rooms (got regular upgrades to a junior suite as a platinum member) and the lounge at the top floor. friendly personel, always helpful. this hotel is definitely my first choice whenever i'm in seattle

Reviews.Title: “Very service oriented staff, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Maine1231
Reviews.Content: We had called priority club to see if they could get us into this hotel using points /2 queen size beds for our family of four as the website didn't have those rooms with points. The hotel was willing to do that. We also got the room with the conceirage level as we are platinum priority club members. We are so grateful to priority club and this hotel for doing that as it was a long way to travel across county to get to Seattle for the start of a vacation. The staff was great, room comfortable, easy walk to the waterfront, tram to the Needle, shops. Parking was a bit pricey but it's a city. The car was retrieved promptly. Easy to get to from the hi way. The elevators were very slow, so crowd in folks! Very quite hotel for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: jmimih
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable bed. The magnifying mirror in the bathroom is a little thing that makes traveling life so much easier. Enjoyed having an armchair in the room. But most of all, the staff was exceptional. All staff we dealt with were polite and capable, and many were friendly and helpful. We appreciated the tips and help from the concierge service. Our housekeeper (12th floor) was friendly and gracious. Extra-special thanks to director of operations Tarig G., who went out of his way to help us when my husband had to go to the hospital, and our tour group had to go on without us. Tarig made us feel that we were not so stranded as we might have thought. If we ever get back to Seattle, we would love to be able to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for - A++++ Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sleeplessINct
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the Club Level in a particular room (I won't reveal the room number) and BOY o BOY, was it the perfect room! There is only 4 of these rooms in the entire hotel. It was a perfect view of the space needle and the sky line. I couldn't have asked for a different room. The room was beautiful, the service was A+ and I wouldn't change a thing. The location was perfect. A short walk to the pier to the Market, the first Starbucks, etc. You won't go wrong. Thank you, Crowne Plaza for such a wonderful experience! BTW - The price of the room was soooo cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Large room and good service but the wall is very thin”
Reviews.Author: Cattledogs
Reviews.Content: As we travelled back from Vancouver on Amtrak at night, I chose to stay at the regular chain hotel for one night. Instead of two rooms, we got one King-bed suite. The room was large and clean, but we could not find a way to turn one floor lamp on. There were a few long hair left in the bathroom. The front staff was very helpful even at late night. Room service was also good too. There was a view of Space Needle. But the wall was so thin that you could not hear TV when the guests next door happened to be loud talkers. It probably is hard to complete with new stylish hotels, but I think they were trying hard by rennovation and the good service.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable central hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Campbie
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel which I visited for an unusually long 6 night stay in association with a meeting. Yes it was somewhat dated but the room was fine with a good view from 27 Floor. Clean spacious and everything worked. Situation wise, it was a 40$ cab fare from the airport (although the light rail is only two blocks away) and an easy walk from the harbour front, Pike Street market and Space Needle. Parking would have been an issue as it is limited and very expensive. Ate breakfast buffet once and it was substantial with good coffee and only 10$ for a priority club member. Similarly, lunches and bar meals reasonable as was alcohol within the nightly happy hour. Gym was small but reasonably well equipped with modern equipment. No pool though. Man gripes ? The lifts were not really up to the task with a lot of waiting at peak times and also many large groups of tourists often cluttering the lobby. Internet would have been expensive but was free in meeting room and there are many local branches of Starbucks/ other sites with free WiFi you can use.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Good location in Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: MinnTravelor
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a Friday-Tuesday couple weekend. I booked the tickets through Hotwire.com. So since I'd never used Hotwire before, I assumed I would be staying in the worst room in the place. This was an incorrect assumtion. I call the hotel a couple of days before we left and ask if they could put a note on my reservation that we were there to celibrate my wife's 40th birthday. So when we arrived, the girl who checked us in saw that note and took care of us. She put us on the 26th floor with a view of the Space Tower and a partial view of the water front. It was an executive king-bed room. The room was very nice and was 1st class. **I was a little concerned at first, since the room was right next to an elevator. This turned out not to be an issue at all. We never heard the elevator or any guests using it. I didn't even have to ware my ear plugs the entire stay. Location: The hotel was in a good location. We were 2.5 block from the light rail, which we took from the airport & back. The light rail was great!!! $2.50 each way and we never waited for a train!!! It was clean and felt very safe. I will use it again. 5 blocks from water front. So walking wasn't so bad. We also made our way on foot to Space Tower via monorail, Pike's Place, Safeco Field for a baseball game (we took the light rail there.) **Disclaimer: Seattle is very very hilly. So be prepared to walk up hill all the time. Big big hills. Breakfest: We ate breakfest at the hotel's buffet in the morning 2x. It's a litlle crowded, but if you get there from 6am-7ish, you'll have the place to yourselve.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good with room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Halgrimm
Reviews.Content: I'd like to separate my eveluation into three sections: 1. The staff - very polite and friendly. Good service 2. The room - in general - the rooms are indeed old and therefore quite yellowed. But the equipment is okay, bed king size, flat screen TV, bathroom functional and neat. Special - I cannot recommend room 1058 - it's near the elevator. You can hear the growling of the machines the whole day and night! 3. Environmet/infrastructure - The bar in second floor is quite good. Good beer on tab, the menue is okay. Prizes okay.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel - great views”
Reviews.Author: 1BadHog
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 30th floor overlooking Puget Sound and the Space Needle. Incredible views. Great hotel but almost too big to be comfortable and of the 5 employees with whom I spoke only one understood English well enough to be functional. Otherwise a very good property.

Reviews.Title: “Business Class Accomidations”
Reviews.Author: apfulk
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, rooms were nicely decorated, beds were comfertable. I wouldn't pay the high prices the hotel charges for a vacation though. I was inside some of the other downtown hotels, hotels that are similar in class to the Crowne Plaza, and the other hotels were more modern and fresher looking. My biggest compliant was the doors do not go all the way to the floor, so in the morning, the hustle and bustle of the hallways will wake you well before you desire. Both mornings I was awakned well before I inteded by the housekeeping services in other rooms surrounding mine. The staff was helpful and friendly. We stayed on the Club Floor so were able to enjoy the complimentary breakfast buffet. Decent offerings- bagels, fruit, muffins, cereal and assorted beverages.

Reviews.Title: “BIG, BIG THANK-YOU TO CROWNE PLAZA AND THE STAFF!!!”
Reviews.Author: klipschfan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel from 7-14-10 to 7-16-10 (Prior to our 25th Anniversary 7-day cruise to Alaska). First, let us say that this hotel went over and beyond the call of duty (way beyond our expectations. To the FRONT DESK STAFF at check-in: We forgot their names but their professionalism and kindness were just so...well...just oustanding. To the Conceige, SAM: He really earned his $$$ with us, he was so helpful. To the Bell person ALLEN: Allen remember us the couple from Indiana (near Chicago), we thought you were the the greatest...thank-you. Last and certainly not least, this individual and company arranged our vacation/cruise (Travels By Charlotte), you know who you are. You will always have our services. TBC and CPH, thank-you for the King Room upgrade, and the BIG chocolate covered strawberries with the HUGE bottle champaign. "BIG, BIG THANK-YOU TO TBC AND CPH!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: terpnut
Reviews.Content: We had a great four-night stay at this hotel this past week. We reserved a junior suite but arrived in the morning so our room was not ready. The bellmen agreed to take our luggage and the front desk staff told us they would call us when the room was ready. We walked to Pike Place Market (about 8 blocks in all) for shopping and lunch, and the hotel called before 3 pm to inform us that our room was finally ready. The service overall was outstanding--from front desk check-in and other help, to the bellmen, to the restaurant wait staff to the housekeeping crew. Housekeeping checked in on us regularly, keeping us regularly supplied with things we needed, and even offered turn-down service. We've stayed at alot of very good hotels, but this hotel's staff stood out! The suite was very clean and comfortable. Like most hotel rooms, many things just don't make sense--like the rooms were laid out or designed by an interior designer and not by an architect. There was a large bedroom and closet but no dresser to put your clothes in. There was just one hook in the bathroom. And why don't hotels put a small coat closet next to the front door (instead of one large closet in the bedroom)? A couple nice touches included drapery clips to keep the light out in the morning, and welcome kit that includes a bed spread spray, ear plugs, etc. The hotel's location is very good but not necessarily the most central. It is a 6-10 block walk to Pike Place Market, the water front, Aquarium, and Pioneer Square. Safeco/Quest Fields and Seattle Center are much further off and pretty much require a taxi. Being in a primarily business area, there isn't much going on around the hotel itself. Being right next to I-5 was quite convenient for our friends picking us up to go the Museum of Flight (a 15-20 minute drive south of the city). Noise from the freeway wasn't noticeable during our stay. All things equal, I would've preferred to be closer to the water front, Pike Place Market or Westlake areas, but this hotel's location isn't too bad. The main complaints we had during our stay both centered on the elevators. First, there are only THREE elevators to service the entire 30+ floor hotel! Waits for the elevator can be a bit long. Second, our suite was located directly next to the service elevator and it sounded like a distant train coming most of the time. The noise was not pronounced but noticeable from parts of the suite. I also didn't like being charged for high-speed internet access but this isn't the only hotel that still does this. In general, my opinion is that hotels should stop trying to make money in this day and age on a standard, commodity service like internet access. Overall, it was a great stay for our visit to Seattle and we'd definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Big Rooms, Great Price and 10/10 service”
Reviews.Author: GOCAT14
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is fantastic, probably one of the best in Seattle. They have this really cool video about the hotel and their staff and it really shows that they are committed to providing a good guest experience. Rooms are BIG, and bed was fine, clean rooms. Their is a vending machine on each floor and also in the bottom floor. Breakfast at the hotel is fantastic value and the food was great, free newspapers are everywhere, at the door, room, restaurant. They also have a airline checkin station in the lobby if your interested that covers all airlines that have webcheckin. They also have no free wifi, but in the business center there was free internet on the computers, which might have been a tech issue because they advertise that they charge for it. Should be free anyway. Price was good value at normal rate on Expedia for $109 with the normal $10 off code so pretty good price for such a big and comfy hotel. If ever in Seattle in the future, or if friend/family head up there I will send them here! Cons: -Aircon/Heater unit would not stop! It was that loud that it takes a while to get to sleep sometimes and you cant even change the temperature. -To get the shower/bath working, you need to pull out this metal plug thingy in the wall, its an old device to get the water going and coming from another country I had no clue how to get the water going. -Location is at the top of the hill and walking into Seattle and back is pretty tiring at times.

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel, Convenient, Holding On”
Reviews.Author: TXStevePen
Reviews.Content: The CP has been here for a long time. You can tell the age of the hotel just by the size of the elevators - small. Still they are centrally located in downtown and the owners have made an effort to remain current by updating the decor, adding computer desks and the like. Don't look for swank new bathrooms - it's still a basic shelf-style sink and a bath tub crammed in with a very noisy toilet. But they've made an effort. The room was clean, and the staff friendly and helpful. Being July accommodations in downtown were very limited and prices were high. (My clients paid, but I think 2 nights was around $600.) If I had a choice I would definitely not pay that much for this room, but they're weren't a lot of options. By the way, there's not free internet here. (I hate that. It's so old school to charge $10 a day for internet!)

Reviews.Title: “Business & Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: SueWal65
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I stayed at this hotel for business. It was in a great location to work during the day and close enough to the downtown attractions for evening entertainment...we were able to walk there. I booked my room through Resorts Plus International so I received a better rate than my colleagues, but we were all very happy with the cleanliness and friendly service this hotel provided.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown Seattle hotel - very nice and modern”
Reviews.Author: mark_v_socal
Reviews.Content: I stayed only overnight in this hotel. I have to say it is one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed at - everything was extremely clean, our room, bathroom, the elevators, lobby, etc. Very nice ambiance, the front desk staff were very nice. The only reason I rated it a 2/5 for "value" is because we ended up getting the room for free from my brother's frequent travels, so I don't know how much it would have been but I imagine quite a bit - it was very very nice. I would recommend it to anyone and would love to stay there again. This part of downtown Seattle is very hilly - be prepared to foot it back up the hill to 6fh, up quite steep hills. We ended up taking a cab from the bottom a few times, and the bus once. Great hotel, great service, very clean and modern - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Rates”
Reviews.Author: csjohns7
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate on travel zoo. I was here with eight guys for a bachelor party and the place was fine. It's a little dated, not a five star location but not five star prices either. The rooms were large and clean, the staff was great and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Urban escape”
Reviews.Author: ExiledinExpress
Reviews.Content: Close to everything but a world away. I stayed two nights on a Travelzoo rate and was upgraded to a corner room on the executive floor. Lobby is small but the room was sprawling, totally unexpected for a downtown tower. Travel was for leisure and I saw others there not on business though I felt a little underdressed. The hotel is three blocks and about 150 feet higher from the airport light rail. A combination of walking, bus, and rail will let you see alot of Seattle without a car. Rooms are quiet, clean and service is nearly flawless. Unknown to me the the hotel offered a turndown service. The breakfast buffet at the restaurant is a decent deal but I would not plan to eat other meals there.

Reviews.Title: “A nice clean hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Fleurtai
Reviews.Content: When we first checked into the hotel, we were give a room with a king sized bed...a small upgrade from the standard room we booked. There was a musty smell when we entered the room, but ignored it. We're not really fussy. After coming back to the room a few hours later, it wasn't just musty, it stunk. Of old smoke. It was a room that used to be a smoking room up until a few months prior, we were informed after we called down and asked for a new room. That was no problem at all. We were put into a never-been-smoked-in room and after that, it was great. The location was fantastic and the service very good. Only tiny little complaint would be the breakfast cost vs quality. The 'Healthy Choice" option seemed to be all the sugar, all the time. (Blueberry muffin huge and sweet and topped with...brown suger? Yogurt and granola, sooooo sweet it made my teeth ache.) But a lot of people seemed to like the $15 dollar breakfast buffet, so maybe it was awesome for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great rates, good location”
Reviews.Author: chiliza
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the Crowne Plaza Downtown Seattle. Our room on the 30th floor was clean and comfortable, and had an excellent view of the Space Needle and Puget Sound. Plus, the location was excellent--only a few blocks walk from the ferries, Pike Place Market, and the nightlife of Capitol Hill. The unbelievable thing is that all of this was had for the rate of $89.00, and that included free parking. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown hotel - Loved Seattle! April 2010”
Reviews.Author: HappyNorsk
Reviews.Content: We live in Victoria, BC and arranged a "Clipper Vacation" - taking the Clipper from Victoria to Seattle. I'm not sure which hotels are partnered with the Clipper. We stayed at the Crowne Plaza. It was clean, up-to-date decor, friendly staff. The room was lovely - a king sized bed, and we had the option of staying on a delegated "quiet floor". There was a fitness room with good equipment, and also a "business room" with two computers. The only way this hotel could have been better would be if they had a pool. (this is why i gave location & value only 4 out of 5 - If it had a pool, everything would have been 5/5) I was really disappointed as I had brought a swimsuit & was really looking forward to a relaxing swim. Other than that, yes, it is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located cookie-cutter hotel but comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Harmiclir
Reviews.Content: Room was bigger and more nicely-appointed than I'd expected. Lobby is OK--no real common space. Clean and safe hotel, just not elaborate. I have absolutely no idea why some of the negative reviews have as much energy as they do--some folks seem not to have inquired very much about the hotel, its services and the costs before assuming they were, or should have been, free. As others have said, parking can be very difficult and expensive in downtown Seattle. You can save a lot of money by driving across the nearby I-5 overpass and parking in a lot within a five to ten minute walk of the hotel. A good, basic chain hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Add $32/night to your stay for parking”
Reviews.Author: NurseLovesVacation
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel-great views-great location. If you have a car add $32/night to your bill. They DO NOT offer self parking-valet only and it is $32/night. Totally ridiculous. I would only stay here again if I did not have a car with me.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiisurfer69
Reviews.Content: Great location - Nice clean, quiet rooms - Great views - Excellent friendly customer service - Nice restaurants. Honorable, professional staff. This hotel is a little older but overall a fantastic value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Cdn_Wmn
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean Friendly and helpful staff Large room. We had two double beds w/plenty of room remaining to move around and were not on top of each other Good sized bathroom Quiet but we were not on the freeway side Comfortable beds, bedding, and pillows Good lighting Cons: Really, really, really loud heater. So much so that it drowned out the TV and we had to turn the heat off at night as it woke us up. Not sure I would stay at the hotel again b/c of how loud it was. No mini bar in room to use as a mini fridge. Was advised the mini bar/fridge is an add'l per night charge but the front desk clerk willingly and quickly supplied one gratis $37 / night parking. Appears to be the going rate at all the downtown hotels but in my opinion the Crowne Plaza should not charge the same rate as the Westin Charge for WiFi Minor stuff: No cork screw in the room, called down to housekeeping. 3/4 of an hour later when went out for dinner still waiting for the corkscrew. Fan in bathroom didn't work. Apparently environmentally friendly based on the signs about re-using towels, etc, but no recycling containers for paper, cans, etc On the edge of downtown but not a big deal. Everything still within easy walking distance. Only one arm chair and one office chair. Should have had two arm chairs. I've checked that I would recommend this hotel to a friend but that is only if the heater is fixed and the rack rate is significantly discounted. Otherwise, no.

Reviews.Title: “It was comfortable, and the staff was friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: 1Alaskan
Reviews.Content: I got the hotel room for a great price, using on online discount site. The staff was very helpful and friendly. There was a working fireplace and some comfortable chairs in the lobby. The king size bed had a pillow top, and on the bed was a pretty bag with lavender linen spray, ear plugs & face mask. The room included a safe, desk and office-type chair, plasma TV, nice quality ice bucket, coffee maker, CD player/radio/alarm clock. The heater was a bit loud, but I was so tired that I didn't notice it after a while. The bathroom included a clothesline, hair drier, nice shower head, magnifying mirror, night light, and great smelling shampoo, conditioner & lotion (not too masculine or feminine). There was a note on the big mirror saying that if you forgot to bring anything, such as toothpaste, comb or whatever, that they would bring you a complimentary replacement. The toilet was too low. I felt like I was going to fall into it every time I used it. The closet had an iron & ironing board, wooden clothes hangers and extra pillows. The room seemed large, and was very quiet (when the heater wasn't running!). It was a little bit of an uphill hike from the Westlake Mall, but it would probably be a lot easier to get to via cab or car. It's a shame that my room didn't have a little refrigerator. I had a great stay at that hotel, and wish I could have stayed there longer. I didn't use the valet parking, room service or wi-fi, so I can't comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “very good location just dont bring a car”
Reviews.Author: Stevep5553
Reviews.Content: Our room was upgraded to the 31 floor so great views over the city and convenient location and you get the benefit of being able to use the lounge for snacks in the evening and a light breakfast. Rooms are standard hotel type but clean and comfortable , beds very comfortable, heater/aircon can be a bit noisy, large flat screen TV. Happy hour in the bar early evening is good value. The big problem is you are in downtown Seattle and car parking is very expensive hotel valet parking gets close to $40 per night. On a Saturday / Sunday night you can park for free on the street if you can find a space and some local car parks are cheaper if you are prepared to walk. Hotel is very convenient for downtown, and lot of choice locally to eat and drink. Just the normal mid range hotel problems of $10/ day Internet and expensive hotel phone if you use.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy rooms and thieving valet atendants.”
Reviews.Author: WaltzinMatilda
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at this hotel (Feb 19-22), to explore downtown. Hotel location is excellent for this activity. Rooms were old but clean and EXTREMELY NOISY! I have never stayed at a motel or hotel that supplies EARPLUGS WITH THE ROOM!!! Most expensive valet parking ($37/D) I have experienced even compared with NYC prices! DO NOT LEAVE ANY VALUABLES IN YOUR CAR WHEN VALET PARKING! After leaving hotel I discovered that all my "parking" change had disappeared from the center console. Dollar bills as well as quarters, nickles and dimes (~$15). The only people that had access to my vehicle in Seattle were the valet attendants. VALET ATTENDANTS STOLE IT ALL!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: stephrouthier
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay here, and thought the hotel was great. Perfect location, everything was within a 10-15 minute walk, and there were loads of restaurants/shops etc right outside the front door. We were upgraded to a suit with an amazing view out the bedroom and living room windows (room 2656). The rooms were a great size, bed was super comfy, good bathroom. We didn't order any room service or try out the restaurant/bar. Staff were all really friendly and helpful. I'd definitely stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Warning don't use hotel phone even if desperate!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: just4casting1
Reviews.Content: This is a warning to anyone anywhere using a Crowne Plaza Hotel, but particularly Seattle. I made 2 very brief phone calls from my room to home (which should have cost about $6 each). I was charged $52 - THAT'S RIGHT - FIFTY-TWO DOLLARS! Read the room's phone rate card, and you'll see why... "can you say extortion boys and girls? I think you can!!!!" Basically, they charge fees on top of fees on top of fees. That's not providing a service, that's gouging!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: CaitlinK
Reviews.Content: When I checked in, I upgraded to a suite with a wonderful view. I was also given access to the lounge, which served some great snacks in the evenings. The breakfast there wasn't bad either. My room was very comfortable and had a great view. The staff here are fantastic! This is a very great location for tourists, you can walk to just about anywhere in downtown. I highly recommend staying at this Crowne Plaza for your next visit to Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, loud heaters”
Reviews.Author: woobers
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on Priceline so I decided to check out this hotel. The place is very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. I was a bit disappointed when I walked into my hotel room and saw two beds. You would think that they would give a couple a king bed, but I guess I didn't make my preferences clear. Absolutely love the location since it is fairly close to everything. The only downsides to this hotel were that the heater was very outdated. If you are a light sleeper and want a warm room, the heater may keep you up most of the night. Also, parking is 37.50 for valet but that is pretty standard on staying at a downtown hotel. There is no free wi-fi, but I hear they have a business center. Would I stay here again? Possibly for a lower price, but it was comfortable and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Crown Plaza”
Reviews.Author: BobBenzin
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveller I was treated to a room with a great view on a high floor with catered breakfast served in a lounge on that floor.

Reviews.Title: “Highly reccomend”
Reviews.Author: mgv94102
Reviews.Content: I stay here a LOT and I love it! Beds are amazing location is fabulous rooms are comfortable staff is friendly

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel in Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: moviechic8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here four night for work. It is your basic business hotel, nothing fancy. But it is very clean, comfortable and nice. The location in downtown Seattle is ideal. Everything is pretty much within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: heou87
Reviews.Content: Front desk agents and bellman were the big plus for this hotel. They're all friendly and eager to help. Though we have stayed at hotel with better room and view, this hotel was definitely my favorite thanks to the staff. I will definitely stay here when I come back to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “...never walked in the front door!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AUDOG
Reviews.Content: my family and i are new to the state and thought that it would be nice to drive in to seattle for the upcoming thanksgiving weekend. due to unexpected circumstances had to cancel plans. called 2 days prior to arrival date (was told i had until 6pm the day before arrival to cancel free and clear) to be told by reservations that it was too late to cancel without having to pay the one day deposit. i was referred to the front desk where i was then told that i should be able to cancel but they weren"t sure what the cancellation policy was so i had to call back in the morning to cancel. WHAT!!!!!!!!!!!!???????????does anyone know the policies? so anyway while steaming over having to deal with this another day i go the hotel website directly and found a place where you can log in and view your rez. i couldn"t log in at first. it took ten tries because they spelled my name wrong (which i never knew because they never sent me my email confirmation that i requested four times). so anyways i cancelled there but will be calling to confirm that tomorrow. it is a shame that i ahd to get a straight answer i had to go to the web (where they told me that i have until 6pm the day before to cancel) the staff seem a bit clueless theses are the first people that we speak to before we get there and they are clearly not selling this hotel like this. i hope that this is not a reflection on how other things are run there. will be reconsidering whethere to plan another stay at the crown when we make it to seatlle.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmmm”
Reviews.Author: Phillip66
Reviews.Content: Before I got to the hotel, I called from home and asked if I would be able to park my rental car. They said valet was available for $32 a day but that I could easily find street parking. There was no street parking, so valet here I come. The desk staff was friendly. The room was freezing cold and I could not find an electrical outlet without unplugging my laptop. Then I found a power strip nailed to the back side of the dresser. Then when I went outside to get my car to go to dinner, the valets were playing catch with a football on Seneca Street and the ball actually hit my car when we pulled out. Oh well, I am a good sport and it was a nerf. Then, this morning, I showed up at the restaurant on the second floor for breakfast at 6:10 and it was deserted. The sign says it opens at six. I really needed a coffee and breakfast. Coming from an eastern time zone, it was 8 am to me. I did not have breakfast. The room was dated. Just too many little things went wrong... But the price was very good-- only $118 for a Sunday night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: tutu06
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay at this hotel in downtown Seattle. This hotel is an excellent choice for any stay in Seattle. We have been to this city three times and would highly recommend that anyone stay here. The staff is extremely accomodating and pleasant. We stayed on the 29th floor which included the breakfast and appetizers in the evening which is well worth the extra money! The room was very clean and spacious. Ask to face the space needle which also gave us parital ocean view. The location could not be better especially as far as the shopping goes and downtown tourist attractions. We will definitely return. Hats off to the wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brewthemonkey
Reviews.Content: We got a room at this hotel through Priceline. I read the reviews, got worried, and didn't know what to expect. When we got there at 1PM we got checked in right away into a lovely non-smoking room with a king sized bed. The room was clean, staff were friendly, and the food was great. The location is ideal as well. The only downside was the parking (as almost everyone says). It was almost double every other hotel's parking fee at $37.50 per night.....we were not very impressed with that. I will stay there again but will try and figure out another place to park.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: jane_birkin
Reviews.Content: one of the most comfortable beds i have ever slept in. the room was very comfortable and spacious. i had a corner room so i had a beautiful view of seattle through large windows. i got a terrific deal through Hotwire.com so i paid about 30% less than the list price for my room. the room was extremely clean. i have serious allergies to dust, so i always notice if the pillows or blanket have that thin layer of dust on them--this was pristine. the front desk staff were helpful and polite--exactly as they should be but so often you get lousy service that i'm impressed when i get good service. the one misstep was when a woman at the front desk told me there was usually a cab waiting outside the hotel. it took me 20 minutes to hail a cab in the pouring rain, and there wasn't one out in front of the hotel during the 2 days of my stay. better to call and reserve a cab ahead of time when it's raining! overall i was very happy with the crowne plaza and i hope i get to stay there again! the proximity to all things downtown was enormously important.

Reviews.Title: “200.00 a night and not even soaps in bathroom!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cleo011
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the crown with my friend for 5 nights and 6 days, for 200.00 a night i was expecting class A treatment and little things in the bathroom and room. with all the airline limitations i had to asked for a soap, they gave me 1, mini that in for baths was... gone, come on you charge 200.00 and the customer needs to beg, no way; definitely im not used to this treatment. then we asked how to get on highway for portland,oregon and the front desk oriental girl didnt know, wich is fine maybe shes new, but her attitude was like umm,umm and didnt pass the buck, another no,no. very,very dissapointed,and i will never go back to crown plaza hotel at seneca street, so expensive the parking place 32.00 a night and not even nice soaps at the room??? something wasnt right, ah>

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but the pub sucks...”
Reviews.Author: mugsyvictoriaB_C_
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was fine. Clean, well laid out, nice employees etc. The pub on the second floor was another matter. Very slow service and the Texas Chilly on the menu comes right out of a can and you don't even get a roll or piece of bread. The draft costs a dollar more per glass (Pint?) than it should and the waiter tried to stiff me for one he forgot to deliver. I would stay here again only I would go 2 blocks down the road for draft at $4.50 a pint as well as better food.....

Reviews.Title: “Another enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Holidaytravelfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the 2nd time as I received another great deal which makes me rate it with 5 stars. We got a great room on the 30th floor with beautiful views of the ocean and the city incl. the Space Needle. Room was very spacious with comfy beds and a large TV. The room had a connection door which had us hear the neighbors doing things at night we didn't really want to hear....At a high end hotel I would in general expect better soundproofing. Other than that, the location is great with all sights being in walking distance. We didn't use any of their facilities. Valet Parking is expensive but we knew about it.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise Package”
Reviews.Author: 03242011h
Reviews.Content: We checked in early around 2pm. on thursday Sep. 10, the day before our cruise to Alaska. The clerk (rookie?) gave us a small folder with all our coupons and paperwork for room 2353. So, we wait for the elevator and up to our room. But she forgot to put the key cards with the rest of the stuff. Back down to retrieve them. The room had a view and noise of the freeway next to us. The room seemed a lot smaller than the last Crowne Plaza (Houston) that we stayed at, though. And not as nice. The room was ok for the night. We paid $173 plus tax ($199.99 total) for the cruise package. This included the room, 2 breakfast buffets, and 2 shuttle tickets to the cruise terminal. Celebrity left from the Bell Pier, which the shuttle goes to on the 1/2 hour. (On the hour it goes to the other pier.) We left CP after 11:30 and got to ship around noon, when everyone else did. What a mess! We had asked the bell hop about leaving at 10:30, and he told us that was too early. Big mistake. We had planned on checking back in at CP after the cruise. But decided to leave Seattle when the ship docked, and stop in Las Vegas for the weekend. We had flown SW Airlines from Austin to Seattle, so it was easy to change. Thanks SWA. I am a Priority Club Member and thought we would get upgraded to a room with a nice view. Silly me! They didn't even greet me as PCM. Oh well Las Vegas was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: sketchy321
Reviews.Content: We were heading to a Mariner's game, and this appeared to be one of the only places with rooms available that didn't cost an arm and a leg. We booked a room with a king size bed, for one night...the cost was just over $200 (American), not including $32 dollar valet service (the only option for parking there). Upon arriving at the hotel, we were greeted by a very friendly front desk worker (Silver), who told us she could offer us a lower rate if we switched rooms. The room being offered was one of the big suites on the 34th (top) floor. The only catch was that the bed was actually two small roller style beds, pushed together. After going to check out the room, we decided to go for it (the rate was amazing, about $88 dollars for the night). Plus, Silver threw in complimentary appetizers, continental breakfast, and agreed to waive our valet parking rate. It took about 15-20 minutes to walk from the hotel to Safeco Stadium (the walk on the way there is mostly downhill). We were warned about walking through the Pioneer Square area at night on the way back (it's sort of a party place), but it was fine. All in all, the hotel provided a decent home base for our one night stay -- and we were very pleased with the friendly & thoughtful service at the front desk. I might have actually ranked them "average" instead of "very good" if not for the service. By the way, the roller beds weren't bad at all -- maybe not as comfortable as a regular bed, but we still got a good night's sleep. Plus, the view was great! Not a bad option if you're in town for a game.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: VesperGirl
Reviews.Content: I only spent one night at the GH Seattle. The hotel location was ok, not in the 'heart' of the tiny city, but good enough to get around to all the touristy areas. The room was good - good space, but the central air/heat was a bit noisy and you have to manually control it, as the thermostat doesn't seem to work or there isn't one. The staff is good and very helpful. I would stay here again and definitely recommend it to others. Clean rooms, good showers - even though I notice the bathroom amenities are below the basics.....just ask for what you need though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, No Frills,”
Reviews.Author: justinemiller79
Reviews.Content: Crowne Plaza was nice. Rooms were good size, clean and comfortable beds. The staff was helpful with directions and suggestions for while in seattle. The evevators were not that bad at all. At most I waited 5 minutes during a 7 night stay. My room was quiet for the most part. I have seen a few people complain about road noise. We did not notice too much street noise. It is close to the highway and many downtown seattle attactions. it is uphill from almost all attractions in seattle. So bring you walking shoes! No Frills with this hotel. Just a place to sleep. A little pricey for what you get

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: heads_up
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel. It's ideal if you are visiting Seattle on business with appointments downtown or events at the convention center (the hotel is a short walk to the convention center). It's also ideal for shopping downtown as most of the main shopping areas start near the hotel. The staff is excellent. Some key items to consider: 1) The hotel is a medium walk, with some steep hills, to many tourist attractions, which could be a bit far for some individuals. However, bus transportation downtown is free. 2) Parking is expensive (although I understand that all of downtown Seattle has expensive parking). We paid approximately $37 per night, including tax, for on-site valet parking. 3) Internet at the hotel is good, but expensive. It was approximately $19 for 48 hours. 4) The gym features above average resistance training and cardio equipment relative to most hotels that I've stayed at. However, there is no pool or hot tub. The area around the hotel, in terms of being a safe neighborhood, is good for jogging/running. There is a major fitness facility a few blocks away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've ever stayed at using Priceline!”
Reviews.Author: Jendicusano
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in at 12:30 am I was issued a 'parlor' portion of a suite with a single roll away cot as my bed. I was traveling on business with 5 other and had invited my husband to come along. They 'kindly' wheeled in another cot 45 minutes later. When I argued at the desk the Priceline guarantees a BED that is double or 2 twins they stated they can do whatever they like since I used Priceline. The customer service was horrendous and I don't care not to relive the experience here but I travel using Priceline hotels 2 times a week on average throughout the entire US and this was by far the worst I've ever seen. I truly loved Priceline and embrace the risk of bidding because often the reward of a luxury 5 star hotel for $70 a night is well worth it. I'm now a bit sour based on this hotel. Needless to say the 2nd day our toilet exploded (yes, not just an overflow) and the 3rd the elevators broke with no ETA on a fix we were instructed to walk the 26 flights of stairs to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location. A little on the expensive side.”
Reviews.Author: gma-pam
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel. Very clean and the room was very roomy. We had a corner room and could see for a long way. Within walking distance of the pier and most other attractions in downtown Seattle. Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “huge room”
Reviews.Author: fsba20
Reviews.Content: booked this through Hotwire and got a great deal. The room was huge, nice comfy bed and great view of the city. Location was good, not too far from the main part of town, also a great pizza place opposite called Mod - perfect for a takeaway. The concierge was also very helpful at the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased!!”
Reviews.Author: karenmsu97
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 5 nights. Our room was located on the 17th floor with 2 beds. It was quite roomy and comfortable.I was a little weary before arriving after reading previous comments on this page. However, I did not not encounter any of the problems that were mentioned here. The Crowne Plaza is a great hotel with very courteous, well- informed staff. Our room was very clean and in excellent condition. We also had a fairly decent view, however had we been about 10 more floors up it would have been even better. Also , the location of this hotel is excellent for doing all sorts of downtown activities. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal room and location near theater in downtown Seattle”
